If he cannot supply the punchline or offers an incorrect punchline, the player to his left is given the chance to answer. If that player gives the correct punchline he wins the card. If he fails then the player to his left is given a chance and so on round the group. When the correct punchline has been given, the player who gave it is awarded the card, or when no correct punchline has been given, the card is placed at the bottom of the pack. It is then the second player's turn. He chooses any number between one and six and the Joke Teller reads out the joke. The process is repeated until one player has won five cards. That player is the winner.

Game Three: JOKERS WILD for three to six players.
The winner is the player with most cards at the end of the game.
The cards are shuffled and placed in the middle of the players. Player No 1 picks the top card and reads out a joke on the card. If one of the other players thinks he knows the punchline,that player shouts out “Joker!” and gives the punchline. If the punchline given is correct that player wins the card. If it is incorrect the card is placed at the bottom of the pack and the player who gave the wrong punchline misses one round which means that he cannot give the punchline to the next joke even if he knows it. It is then the turn of Player No 2 to pick a card from the pack and read out a Joke. The process is repeated round and round the group until all the cards have been won, and the player with most cards is the winner. A player cannot offer a punchline to a joke he is reading out himself. If two players shout “Joker!” at exactly the same moment the younger of the players gets to offer the punchline.

For a variation on the three games try the following: even if a player gives an incorrect punchline, the Joke Teller may award that player the card if they decide that the alternative punchline given is clever or funny enough.

132587.name: Twisted Journeys #01: Captured by Pirates
132587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Match your wits against a band of pirates on the high seas and try to defeat them — or join them! Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132588.name: Twisted Journeys #02: Escape from Pyramid X
132588.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mummies of Pyramid X are on the move — against you! How will you escape? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132589.name: Twisted Journeys #03: Terror in Ghost Mansion
132589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your worst fears come true when you’re trapped in a very haunted house! Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132590.description:
The Peruvian Inquisition is a special promo card given out at SPIEL 2012 in Essen and expands the Agricola The Legen*dary Forest Deck.

Description of the card:

"Nobody expects the Peruvian Inquisition"

Replace all sheep on your farm with llamas. At the end of the game, llamas are scored for all players, using the same values as for sheep.
132590.name: Agricola: The Legen*dairy Forest Deck – Peruvian Inquisition

132591.name: Epoch
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
2013 ENnie for Product of the Year - Nominee
2013 Indie Game of the Year Runner-Up
2013 Indie RPG Awards Best Production Runner-Up
2013 Indie RPG Awards Best Support Runner-Up
2013 Indie RPG Awards Most Innovative Game Runner-Up
132591.description:
Subtitle: Experimental Paradigm of Cinematic Horror

From the introduction:
EPOCH is a game of character-driven survival horror. The goal is to deliver a tense and scary experience in a single game session.

There will be blood… EPOCH is a game of survival horror, and much like a movie, not all of the characters can expect to survive until the final scene. Unlike many other games, EPOCH players have complete control over the fate of their characters. They may know the rules of the horror genre, but who becomes a victim, and how, is different every time.

There will be drama… EPOCH rewards interesting character play with increased chances of character survival. Players are not just the protagonists, but also act as the audience who hold the fate of all the characters in their hands. Using a simple, flexible, character creation method, players shape their back story to reveal interesting facts and surprising twists.

There will be a reckoning… EPOCH assumes a high level of character competence. Skills and abilities are streamlined, placing the focus back on the characters’ story and the personal impact of the horror. But victory is never assured; evil may prevail, and the true cost of the horror is never fully revealed until the final credits roll.

132592.description:
This is a promo card given away at SPIEL 2012 in Essen to promote the Belgium Deck. The Brakel is a chicken breed from Belgium, named after a region there. The card is numbered 'FL061'.

Brakelhühner is a minor improvement and costs two food to build, which are put on the card. In every harvest phase, if there are at least two food on this card, it produces one additional food. The food can be taken from this card at every time. If, at game end, there are at least 4 food on this card, it counts as two victory points.
132592.name: Agricola: Brakelhühner Promo Card

132593.name: Twisted Journeys #04: The Treasure of Mount Fate
132593.description:
From publisher blurb:

Test your courage against skeleton warriors, a powerful wizard, and the dreaded borkadrac! Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132594.name: North Shore-opoly
boardgameversion: Minor Games Limited signed and numbered edition
132594.description:
Property trading game about the places, plants and animals of the North Shore of Minnesota bordering Lake Superior.
The game utilizes the watercolors of Brian Minor and Rebecca Minor to illustrate the game board, game box and deed cards.
Manufactured individually by hand in Superior, WI by Brian Minor and his family.
Playing pieces are actual pebbles collected from the shore of Lake Superior.
Each property deed has the history of the place you are purchasing. Highlighting interesting educational points of interest.
Each game is individually numbered and signed by the creator/artist Brian Minor

132595.description:
"¡Guka Croka!" translated from the much known troglodyte language, means: "HURRY UP, AMONG THE DINOSAURS, WE MUST ARRIVE TO THE CAVE ON TIME TO HAVE DINNER!!"

In this game, each troglodyte must arrive to the cave, only the fastest will be winner, so you need good luck rolling the dice and good memory to remember where dinosaurs hide to escape from them as quickly as you can.

Game is a combination of roll-and-move and memory elements. Players build circuit from hexagonal tokens, each carrying picture of one of 12 dinosaurs, faceup adding "Start" hex as a first one and "Cave" hex as last one. There are 4 addtional hexes that give "special action" - two "ladder" and two "extra roll". Additionally there 12 tiles with same 12 dinosaurs which is arranged in separate 4x3 grid, face down. When arriving at particular hex with dinosaur picture player has one try to find same dinosaur in facedown 4x3 grid - if successfull he rolls a die and moves again. First player to arrive to "Cave" hex wins the game.
132595.name: ¡Guka Croka!

132596.name: Delfi 10
132596.description: Trivia board game published on 10th anniversary of Delfi news site. The players roll a die and step the given amount on the board. Previous player takes a card and reads a task or question to the player. If he/she carries out the task or answers correctly, he/she gains the card and points shown on it. The game ends when the first player reaches the finish on the track. Then the points are added up and the biggest score wins.

132597.name: Aarresaari
132597.description:
A children's game based on Mauri Kunnas' version of R.L. Stevenson's Treasure Island.

Players have five cards, each of which shows three types of treasure items. The game board has three rotating wheels with the pictures of treasure, and they must be aligned so that the combinations in the cards are shown on the board. On each turn, player gets to rotate the wheels 1–3 steps, depending on a die roll.

After the active player has rotated the wheels, all players check if the combinations in their treasure cards show up on the board. If they do, players can discard the matching cards. Whoever gets rid of her cards first, wins the game.

132598.name: Black Swan
132598.description: In this partnership-trick taking game, the seventh card played in a round wins the trick. On their turn players can play a single card or combinations (straight, pair, triplets). The seventh card played wins the trick. Some cards count as positive, some negative, some nothing.

132600.name: Drawbridge (2nd Edition)
132600.description:
From the designer:

This new edition of Drawbridge offers rules for classes and magic while removing information not vital to the game's mechanics.

From the introduction:

Welcome to the Drawbridge Role-playing Game! With this booklet, some paper and pencils, and a few 6-sided dice you have everything you need to create amazing fantasy adventures with your friends!

What makes Drawbridge special? Drawbridge:


is fast-paced
is rules-light
only uses 6-sided dice
and is 100% Free!


If you enjoy Drawbridge, please share it with your friends! If you want to make your own additions to the game, by all means do so!

132601.description:
Bellum Gallicum II is a historical simulation which retraces the campaigns of Julius Caesar in Gaul from 58 to 51 BC, or from 696 to 703 ab Urbe Condita (since the foundation of the city), if one follows the Roman manner of counting years. One player takes the role of Julius Caesar and controls the Roman forces, their Gallic allies and German mercenaries. The other player takes on the interests of those Gallic tribes trying to defend their independence.

Bellum Gallicum contains several independent scenarios and a campaign game which covers the whole of the Gallic Wars.

Each of the 9 scenarios covers one annual campaign in its historical context.

The campaign game covers the whole of the Gallic Wars and runs as a series of annual campaigns. For each of these the Gallic player may choose to lead a revolt or to remain at peace. Victory is decided by the accumulation of campaigns won by the Roman player. The game may however stop at any moment if the conditions for a decisive victory are met.

The present version of Bellum Gallicum is a development of the original game which appeared in Casus Belli, issues number 68 and 69 (1992). It contains new developments of the rules, in particular in those chapters covering combat.

Contents:

One Rules and Scenarios booklet
One 41x59 cm map
216 die-cut counters
2 color Player-Aids




Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).
132601.name: Bellum Gallicum II

132602.name: The Bootleggers
132602.description:
"The Bootleggers" 1920's & 30's Rules for the Prohibition Era

"The Bootleggers" is a 40 page adventure / skirmish game for use with Steve Barber's 25mm Prohibition Wars figures. This is a game for 2 or more players with 4 to 20 figures per player. It also includes historical character listings for use in the game.

With these rules, it is possible to design scenarios ranging from the simple to extremely complicated. Examples are provided at the manufacturer's web site for a "St. Valentine's Day" game, as well as a night ambush of a liquor shipment. It would certainly be possible to make a free-for-all with quite a few players - this would be perfect for a convention game.

The ground scale appears to be about 10' to the inch; the time scale is a bit more nebulous. Turns are taken one figure at a time, with initiative order determined by the roll of a d-10. A figure's turn consists of one action, typically a move or a shooting attack, but many other actions are considered by the rulebook.

This game also verges on to a role playing game, with detailed rules for character generation, expenses, costs of equipment, careers, etc. It is possible to play a John Dillinger-like character as well as a Federal Agent such as Melvin Purvis. A fairly comprehensive collection of historical personages are provided pre-made to ease one's task of starting the game up.

132603.description: Alcatraz: The Scapegoat - Wrong Plan, a blackmail card initially available from the publisher at Spiel 2012, reads: "A chosen player discards one element of the plan of your choice."
132603.name: Alcatraz: The Scapegoat – Wrong Plan

132604.name: Shokudo
132604.description:
Mr. Miyamoto has died, and now one of his 5 sons will be the heir of his great Japanese food´s restaurant. Each player represents one of the 5 brothers that will try to be enough honorable to win be in charge of the restaurant, by serving the customers...
...But beware, because the spirit of the old man is still walking around the restaurant and he may help you or mess you in a lot of troubles.

This is a card drafting game where each player starts with a different hand and level of honour. They must distribute their turn's actions to serve as many orders as they can to win the amount of honour indicated in that card. The first player to reach 10 honour points wins the game, but if an order is not served, the customer will be angry and everybody lose honour.


El Señor Miyamoto ha muerto, y ahora uno de sus 5 hijos será el heredero de su gran cadena de restaurantes. Cada jugador representa a uno de los 5 hermanos que irá atendiendo pedidos e intentará ser lo suficientemente honorable para hacerse cargo del restaurante...
...Pero tengan cuidado, porque el espíritu del viejo aún camina por el restaurante y puede ayudarte o meterte en muchos problemas.

En este juego, cada jugador comienza con un nivel diferente de honor y productos en su mano. Deben distribuir las acciones de su turno para poder atender la mayor cantidad de pedidos y ganar el honor indicado en éste. El primero en llegar a los 10 puntos de honor gana el juego, sin embargo si una orden no es atendida, el cliente se enojará, por lo que todos los jugadores perderán honor.

132605.name: Don't Play With Drugs: The Game
132605.description:
Too many people treat drugs like a game, well say hi to a game you can treat like drugs.

Don't play with Drugs is a card game on crack; it's addictively fun and a good time with friends. Players will take turns trying to push drugs on each other while trying to keep themselves clean.

Players take turns Playing "clean" cards and " drug cards" on each other. Clean cards will help you get rid of drug cards or do other interesting things. Drug cards are bad, if you have too many drug cards on you, you will "Black out" and someone else must point at you and say "That could never happen to me!" putting you out of the game. The game keeps going until nobody is left (you can always call the last person out the "winner"). Thats right kids, nobody wins.

Don't play with drugs, play with Don't Play With Drugs . . . the game.

132606.name: The Spirit Engine
132606.description:
The Spirit Engine is a 2D, sidescrolling adventure/RPG game with a simple story and a straightforward, innovative real-time combat system. Written as an experimental reaction to old 16bit console RPGs, it took a little under two years to complete and was released in November 2003 as freeware under Natomic.

Although TSE-1 suffers from amateurish scripting and graphics, poor coding, a cumbersome menu system and a slow and unrefined combat engine, I am still proud of what the game achieved. Most importantly I enjoyed playing it and, although it split opinions, I am happy to say that many others did too.

The game concept lays the foundations for The Spirit Engine 2.

The Spirit Engine is FREEWARE. It is free to download but may not be redistributed without consent.

Source: The Developer Website.

132607.name: Gestalt
132607.description:
From the website:

Not only have we discovered life "out there", they've discovered us, and... they don't like us.

Terran defense systems have developed modular multi-pilot mechanical avatars whose individual assets contribute to a greater whole, combining to form custom defense solutions as Earth (and its colonies) prepare to defend themselves from alien forces. These avatars are collectively known as "The Gestalt"

Play cooperatively or competitively as you develop individual Gestalt Components, and try to build the defenders needed to protect your colony. Unlock available technology in the face of impending danger. Stave off menacing alien threats!

Gestalt is a worker placement game, where players (cooperatively or competitively) assign workers to tasks to build Gestalt Mechs. Each piece of the mech provides a number of resources or attributes. Once a mech is ready, you assign those mechs to face an incoming threat. The resources provided by the components is spent, or lost, and some parts will need to be replaced before the next battle. Undefeated threats can destroy parts of the board, cutting you off from valuable resources, so build quickly!

132608.name: Rogue Soul
132608.description:
User Summary

In Rogue Soul you play as a thief who is jealous of the large bounty put out for another. Try to commit as much theft, kill enough guards and cause enough mischief that the bounty on you exceeds the 5000 soulon bounty on Borin Hood. Run, jump, slide, throw daggers, double jump, use a parachute to get as far as you can, but choose wisely, because many of these abilities are limited.

132609.name: Run 2
132609.description:
User Summary

Run or skate as far as you can in this twisting 3D maze. Choose to play as a runner or a skater. The runner doesn't jump as far but is easier to control. The skater jumps farther, but is harder to control. Jump over the holes in the structure and make it as far as you can. If you hit the edges of the structure the maze will rotate so you can find an easier path. Grab the glowing orb for a bonus.

132610.name: Ed Greenwood Presents Elminster's Forgotten Realms
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Art, Interior - Silver Winner
132610.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Forgotten Realms is the most successful and widely known Dungeons & Dragons campaign setting ever created, and it owes its existence to creator Ed Greenwood.

This 160-page hardcover book describes the campaign setting as it lives and breathes in the imagination of its creator. Through the alter ego of Elminster, Archmage of Shadowdale, Ed Greenwood presents the Realms as a setting where companies of crazed adventurers are born and have rich lives, and where they get to call the shots. In this book, Ed presents a world where friendships are forged, endless intrigues unfold, and heroes wage war against the monstrous inhabitants of famous dungeons and untamed wildernesses.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Desktop Published (DTP) / Print-and-Play / Postcard Game Nominee
2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Desktop Published (DTP) / Print-and-Play / Postcard Game Winner
132611.description:
City of Confusion: the Battle for Hue, Tet 1968 covers the attack on the old Imperial capital of Hue by forces of the North Vietnamese Army and South Vietnamese insurgents of the National Liberation Front during the Tet Offensive. The Communist forces hoped a popular uprising by the “oppressed” people in South Vietnam would lead to a general uprising and overthrow of the “puppet” regime supported by the United States. The city of Hue was the only city to be completely occupied by the communist forces during the massive offensive, and was the scene of violent and close-quarter fighting that waged for nearly a month, from January 31st to February 25th, 1968. The general uprising never occurred, and in fact the communist’s disappointment led to atrocities when they massacred hundreds of “collaborators” after they took control. The fighting to retake control of the city and oust the NVA and VC devastated the city and Imperial Palace, symbolizing the tragic and confused nature of the war.

Players are cast in the roles of the commanders of each side’s forces. Both players will have capabilities to inflict harm upon their opponent, while also having liabilities to protect. Contestants will be challenged to do as well, or better than, their historical counterparts. Players use a standard deck of playing cards, one deck for each side, to activate units and resolve some combats. Play is very interactive yet also solitaire friendly.

The map scale is about 100-150 yards per inch. Each combat unit represents a platoon (25 to 30 men, 2 tanks or 6 APCs (Armored Personnel Carriers) and artillery batteries (M-109, Katyusha rockets, and mortars). A game turn represents 2 or 3 days of time.
132611.name: City of Confusion: The Battle for Hue, Tet 1968
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 46: Paul Rohrbaugh of High Flying Dice Games

132612.name: Robin the Boy Wonder
132612.description:
Deal out the cards which each player stacks in a face down pile in front of them. Everyone reveals the top card. The highest card played wins the 'trick' and places the cards won on the bottom of their pile face-down. Play continues like this. If you run out of cards, you are out of the game. The last player still with cards, wins.

Card game for children totally devoid of skill.

132613.name: Superman
132613.description:
A game for two to five players. There are 36 cards in the pack. The object of the game is to get rid of all your cards by playing one at a time. When play has been completed, the cards held in the players’ hands count against them. The lowest score wins.

Select a dealer. Shuffle the cards and deal five, one at a time, face downwards to each player. If there are two players, deal seven at a time. Place the remaining cards face down on the table in front of the players. Turn the top card face up, next to the pile. This is the card on to which other cards will be played. If this card is a Superman card, replace it in the middle of the pile and turn over another.

The person on the dealer's left commences by playing face up on the up turned card, one that matches it. He may play either one of the same number or of the same background colour. For instance, if the first card is a number three Super Boy, yellow, he may play any yellow card or any number three card regardless of colour. All Superman cards ere wild and can be played when a player wishes. After playing a Superman card, the player may play next whatever card he wishes. Play continues in a clockwise fashion.

A player who cannot make a match or play a Superman card. must draw from the pile and does not play that turn. When the centre pile is exhausted, a player passes if he cannot play.

The game is over when either one of the players is out of cards or when nobody can play. Players then total their points, counting each card at face value except the Superman cards which count 25. The game may be continued for a series of runs until one player reaches an agreed number of points, say 100. The lowest scorer then wins.

132614.name: Hunt the Hunny
132614.description:
An action version of games like Snap. There are 36 cards.

Deal out all the cards which players stack in a pile in front of them (without looking at them). Starting with the player left of the dealer, a player turns over the top card in his pile and puts it the centre of the table. Thus, the game progresses. Shouls one of the four Hunny cards be revealed, all the players must race to be the first to touch the card. The fastest player gets all the cards in the centre of the table which go face-down on the bottom of his stack. It is suggested that if at all possible, a referee should be on hand to settle disputes over who was the quickest. If you run out of cards you may still join in the race for the next Hunny card but should you be not the quickest, you are out of the game. In effect, you get a second chance to stay in the game.

The winner is the player who collects all the cards.

132615.name: Füdlibürger. Das Schweizer Schimpfwortspiel
132615.description:
Memory-style game to build swiss-german swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting swiss dialect words.

The game plays exactly like memory. One word ist the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to dicussions about local dialects.

boardgameimplementation: Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhattan!
132616.description:
Deutschland - Finden Sie Minden? Pocket Edition is a trivia game about cities, well-known places and regions. Players draw cards with different places and try to locate them on a map. There is only a total of 11 cities given on the map for orientation.

The goal of the game is to collect as many points as possible. A player can choose to stay on a very superficial level thus indicating that a place is either in the East or West of Germany or can be more specific. The more the specific the guess, the more points a player will get. But if only one of his choices (E-W/ North, Middle, South etc.) is not correct he gets no points at all.
132616.name: Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden? Pocket Edition

132620.description: Gobbit is a fast-playing reaction game in which the last player to have cards in front of him wins. The cards depict three animals in three colors, and the animals eat one another based on their color and a precise food chain: the chameleon eats mosquito, the snake eats the chameleon. As a special card, the gorilla kills all three other types of animals, sending them to the graveyard. If mosquitoes of all three colors are in play, then everyone must race to the graveyard or risk losing all of their cards. Chameleons come into play with the variant rules, with each chameleon having a special power that comes into play when on top of the graveyard.
132620.name: Gobbit
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 81- Inis, Renegade Game Studio Contest, and Geek Out Volume 2

132621.name: Twisted Journeys #05: Nightmare on Zombie Island
132621.description:
From publisher blurb:

Legend says no one can escape the curse of Zombie Island — will you be the first? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132622.name: Twisted Journeys #06: The Time Travel Trap
132622.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are caught in a time machine! How will you escape the perils of the past and the frights of the future? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132623.name: Twisted Journeys #07: Vampire Hunt
132623.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vampire hunters are creeping through an ancient castle with garlic, stakes, and holy water — hunting for you! Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132624.name: Kleine Helden promo card "Legionär"
132624.description:
A promo card for Kleine Helden.

"Legionär" is the German word for "legionnaire". The card can be used as an additional hero for Kleine Helden.

These are the stats of the "Legionär":
Armour: 0
Magic attack: 0
Magic defense: 4
Physical attack: 6
Physical defense: 4
Bonuses: reach weapon +2 attack, shield +1 defense

132625.name: Kleine Helden promo card "Weißer Ritter"
132625.description:
A promo card for Kleine Helden.

"Weißer Ritter" is German word for "White Knight". The card can be used as an additional hero for Kleine Helden.

These are the stats of the "Weißer Ritter":
Armour: 0
Magic attack: 0
Magic defense: 4
Physical attack: 5
Physical defense: 6
Bonuses: resist curses +2, blades +1 damage

132626.name: Kleine Helden 2 promo card "Spion"
132626.description:
A promo card for Kleine Helden 2.

"Spion" is the German word for "spy". The card can be used as an additional NCS card for Kleine Helden 2.

The card reads: "Schau dir die zwei oberen Karten eines Unterstützungsstapels an, bevor du zu Beginn deines Zuges Karten ziehst." (Translation: "Look at the top two cards of one support pile before drawing cards at the start of your turn."

132627.name: Kleine Helden 2 promo card "Der Auftrag"
132627.description:
A promo card for Kleine Helden.

"Auftrag" is the German word for "mission". The card can be used as an mission for Kleine Helden 2.

132628.name: Kleine Helden: Geheimnisse aus der Gruft
132628.description:
A small booklet with scenarios for Kleine Helden that was available as a promotional item.

"Geheimnisse aus der Gruft" is German for "Secrets from the Crypt". The card can be used as an additional hero for Kleine Helden. The booklet offers rules for solo- and coop-play.

132629.name: Twisted Journeys #08: Alien Incident on Planet J
132629.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your spaceship needs a new part, and you’ll never get off this planet if you don’t make peace with the Makaknuk, the Zirifubi, and the Frongo! Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132630.name: Twisted Journeys #09: Agent Mongoose and the Hypno-Beam Scheme
132630.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your top-secret mission: defeat an evil mastermind. But you’ll have to find him first, and spies are all around you! Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132631.name: Twisted Journeys #10: The Goblin King
132631.description:
From publisher blurb:

The battle is on for a magic realm! Will you join the fearsome goblins or the dangerous elves? Can you escape all their tricks and traps and find your way home? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132632.name: Twisted Journeys #11: Shipwrecked on Mad Island
132632.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’ve survived a shipwreck, but mad scientists and mutants are hot on your trail! Will you escape them . . . or join them? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132633.name: Twisted Journeys #12: Kung Fu Masters
132633.description:
From publisher blurb:

Will you succeed on an epic quest in ancient China, full of bandits, ghosts, and flying fists? Can you defeat your foes and become a master of martial arts? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132634.name: Double Dragon II (GB)
132634.description:
Double Dragon II is a 1991 beat-em-up released for the Game Boy developed by Technōs Japan and published by Acclaim in North America and Europe.

Although it is the second Double Dragon game released for the Game Boy, it is unrelated to the arcade and NES game Double Dragon II: The Revenge. The game is a localization of the 1990 Japanese Game Boy game Nekketsu Kōha Kunio-kun: Bangai Rantō Hen (熱血硬派くにおくん 番外乱闘編, "Hot Blooded Tough Guy Kunio: The Further Brawls), which was part of Technōs Japan's Kunio series. The graphics, music, and storyline were changed for the international versions.

The player take control of martial artist Billy Lee, who is being hunted down by an organization called the "Scorpions" for murdering one of its members. The objective of the game is to fight off the members of the Scorpions and confront the true culprit, a rival martial artist named Anderson. Unlike the Game Boy version of the first game, a second player can now join anytime via the use of a Game Link Cable, taking control of Billy's brother, Jimmy.

The play mechanics are simplistic compared to previous Double Dragon games. Like in the Game Boy version of the first game, the player has a punch button and a kick button. However, instead of jumping, pressing both buttons will cause the character to kneel. While kneeling, pressing either button will cause the player to perform a jumping uppercut. Instead of the hair grab from previous games, the player will do a collar grab (similar to Renegade), in which the player can repeatedly knee kick the opponent or toss them. The player also leap over fallen opponents as well. Despite the presence of armed enemies, the player cannot disarm them and pick up their weapons like in other Double Dragon games.

The game is composed of three stages, with four levels for the first two stages and two for the final stage (a total of ten levels). The third and final stage is only available when the game is played on the Normal or Hard difficulty setting.

The Japanese version, Nekketsu Kōha Kunio-kun: Bangai Rantō Hen, was released on December 7, 1990. The Japanese version features completely different graphics (similar to those featured in Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari, the Japanese version of River City Ransom), music, storyline, and characters (with Kunio and Riki being replaced by Billy and Jimmy in the international versions). However, the play mechanics, level designs, and overall structure of the game are otherwise identical.

Source: Wikipedia, "Double Dragon II (Game Boy)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132635.name: Twisted Journeys #13: School of Evil
132635.description:
From publisher blurb:

At Darkham Academy, the teachers are creepy, monsters lurk in the lab, and your dorm room is haunted! Can you survive the first day of school and finish your homework on time? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132636.name: Twisted Journeys #14: Attack of the Mutant Meteors
132636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysterious meteors are making massive mayhem! You could end up as small as a bug or trapped on another planet. Will you become an alien’s pet? Or return to Earth as a rampaging giant monster? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132637.name: Twisted Journeys #15: Agent Mongoose and the Attack of the Giant Insects
132637.description:
From publisher blurb:

As Agent Mongoose, the world's greatest super-spy, you've saved the planet more than once. But when giant insects attack, will your martial arts training and high-tech gear be enough to defeat them? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132638.name: Twisted Journeys #16: The Quest for Dragon Mountain
132638.description:
From publisher blurb:

Knights are waiting outside your lair, ready for a fight. Will you be a nice dragon, or will you flatten them all? Will you hoard gold in your cave, or seek adventure? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132640.name: Twisted Journeys #17: Detective Frankenstein
132640.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery is afoot in London. Thieves roam the graveyards, your best friend is missing, and your creepy boss is building something in his lab. A famous detective is on your side. But does he have secrets of his own? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132641.name: The Whisperer (Issue 1 - Summer 1999)
132641.description:
Cover by Paul Carrick

Subtitled for Call of Cthulhu, Mythos CCG & things Lovecraftian

In this issue you will find articles to inspire and broaden your current or future campaigns.

132642.name: The Battle of Kursk
132642.description:
Game Manual

The KURSK program is a strategy game that simulates tank vs tank warfare on the Russian front in World War II. It features accurate sillouette drawings of eight historical tanks of that period, with each tank rated for the thickness of its front and side armor.

User Summary

This shareware title uses ASCII graphics to simply portray tank-to-tank encounters. The game uses top-down and first person viewpoints.

132645.name: Twisted Journeys #18: Horror in Space
132645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your ship is on a collision course with a black hole—and to make matters worse, alien monsters, mutants, and mutineers are stowed away on board! Can you save the ship — and yourself — from both the saboteurs and powerful cosmic forces? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132646.name: Star Rangers
132646.description:
Players play as a Star Ranger, the equivalent of law enforcement in the 23rd century, a pilot of a high-tech spaceship which you use to repel Tuareg bandits along shared borders.

The game starts in a practice mode in which you continually face waves of enemies until death. This is merely an 'arcade' option of the game, which doesn't explore the minor storyline. The game offers a campaign mode which comprises a group of missions in which these encounters escalate. These missions evolve from incursion defense, to escort duty, even outright assaults.

Players are provided only the Star Ranger spaceship throughout the campaign, but are offered a fair amount of customization of loadout and tuning. You can divert energy to defenses (shield recharge) and offense (plasma gun recharge, autocannon reload). These levels can be adjusted for maximum performance or efficiency, energy being consumed faster in the former than the latter. You acquire a wider variety of missiles for your arsenal as you progress, from 'sharpsticks' to torpedoes.

Enemies vary only slightly, and range from scout craft, to fighters, bombers, transports, cruisers, carriers, and even hostile bases.

Strategy evolves from the mapping system built-in, where the player (and/or his/her wingman) and enemies can travel across a certain area of space. Enemies can attack multiple targets including friendly bases and sensor buoys. Buoys contain map information and so when destroyed or not present act as a rudimentary fog of war. The player has the option, at expense of energy, to warp and near-instantaneously travel across the map to attack, defend, or even refuel at a friendly base.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Rangers (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132647.name: Twisted Journeys #19: The Fifth Musketeer
132647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seventeenth-century France is crawling with bandits, werewolves, and angry swordsmen. You've got the heart, but do you have the courage and brains to survive these dangers and become a musketeer? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132648.name: Backstage Pass (2000)
132648.description:
Back of Box

We've got your ticket to ride.

From Doo-Wop to Hip Hop and everything in between, Backstage Pass delivers the ultimate music trivia experience. With over 600 hard-rockin' questions packed with original music by the original artists, Backstage Pass will test your "heavy mettle" whether you're a pop music encyclopedia or just an easy listener.

So sit back, crank it up and get ready to play the fast-paced music trivia game that puts your ears -- and what's between them -- to the test!


600 questions spanning the entire history of Rock & Roll



Tons of original music by your favorite artists in full stereo



Fast-paced, addictive gameplay



Up to 3 players can go head-to-head to score points and win big

132649.name: Twisted Journeys #20: Peril at Summerland Park
132649.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your friends had no trouble breaking into the abandoned Summerland Amusement Park. Getting out won't be as easy. Can you escape the sinister creatures that dwell among the rides? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132650.name: Twisted Journeys #21: Safari Survivor
132650.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're setting out on a sightseeing safari, looking for real adventure. But are you really ready to cross paths with hungry lions, venomous snakes, and dangerous poachers? Wildlife could turn out to be a lot wilder than you expected! Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132651.name: Twisted Journeys #22: Hero City
132651.description:
From publisher blurb:

You wake up with superhero powers — so what are you going to do with them? Be a hero or rule the city as a supervillain? Use your mighty brains or take advantage of your awesome brawn? Or will you turn down the great responsibility that comes with great power? Every Twisted Journeys graphic novel lets YOU control the action by choosing which path to follow. Which twists and turns will your journey take?

132652.name: The Osiris Files: Operation Nearscape
132652.description:
From publisher blurb:

The DNA of an astronaut and naval aviator declared MIA in 2006 has been found in a fragment from the Tunguska event of 1908. Is the aviator alive? How could his DNA be involved in the explosion of the Tunguska event, 100 years earlier? Osiris is tasked with learning the answers to these questions.

Black projects, super-science, and conspiracies all play a part in Operation Nearscape.

This product is part of the Osiris Files series and is systemless. It is not a complete adventure, but is a "concept module," providing ideas and inspiration built around a central conceit to help the GM build an adventure suited to the GM's campaign.

The Osiris Files: Operation Nearscape was created as the first of a possible series of similar concept modules. If there is interest, the plot arc conceptualized for the Osiris Files will be released through a series of concept modules.

The Osiris Files series

The Osiris Files take place in a world right beside ours. Next door, or perhaps just down the block. People drive cars you would recognize, have jobs you would recognize, and eat food you would recognize. Somewhere, though, there is a shadow world. It might be a world of super spies, super humans, or magic. It might be a world of hidden monsters, ancient threats, or that which man was not meant to know.

The characters inhabit this shadow world. They may pose as accountants, or librarians, or electricians, but they are not. They are not butchers, bakers or candlestick makers. They are something different, something special, and something absolutely dangerous.

The Osiris Files are not adventures, they are concepts. Each operation provides briefing materials, background and ideas. All the material is systemless, and therefore can be used with any role-playing game system. The core of the adventure and its place in the campaign are left to the GM. There are no maps. There is no conclusion. While the concept provides possible conclusions and ideas as to what is happening, there is no set path to solving a problem. The Osiris Files only provide ideas.

132653.name: Accele Brid
132653.description:
Players progress through the game as a robot racing through a pipe, shooting everything that moves. The robot can shoot from both arms, jump, kick and punch. There are also power-ups and bonuses that can be collected to upgrade the robot's weapons and armor.
There are three different types of robots to choose from: Silver Mare, Beliws, and Nitika. Weapons are chosen before each stage and every level has Mode 7 graphics. Three difficulty levels can be chosen; ranging from easy, medium, and hard.

Source: Wikipedia, "Accele Brid", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132654.description:
Two new enahancements in one huge package. First is the Command and Control enhancement which premiers the first of its kind Radio Line of Sight checks. All HQ units must check to see if they have good communication and use a Radio Line of Sight to check this. If the commo check fails the HQ without good commo must check its initiative to see if it will have to attack or regroup or freeze. The HQ will also have to check and see if the commo check is intercepted and/or located. When located the HQ becomes a possible target for enemy artillery counter fire. If the commo check is intercepted the HQ gives up a negative DRM to the enemy player for combats until commo is re-established. The game will now include Signal units that are the focal point for transmissions and maintaining good commo with subordinate and higher HQ. The last and most exciting part of this specific enhancement is the inclusion of German Company level counters and an optional Tiger Tank Battalion that could have joined the battle if the Axis High Command hadn't sent it to North Afrika and wasted it.

Each German Division and Soviet Army have a new Task Organization Chart that provides the players a means to change the assignments of Companies in the case of the Germans and Battalions in the case of the Soviets. These charts are the ultimate in showing the command relationships that change on the battlefield and help to keep the troops organized.

In addition to all this is the Fire Support elements. Counters that show specific artillery battery assignments and what those assignments mean. There are artillery mission markers for Direct Support (DS), General Support (GS), and Reinforcing (R). These missions have specific rules that restrict artillery fire on the field of battle to what they could actually do. Coupled with the Task Organization charts you will need to plan carefully in order to have the right amount of artillery available to support different parts of your divisions. The Fire Support Enhancement gives you the ability to fire smoke and even provides for better counter-battery fire.

There are now some new counters to support play. These are included at the direct request of the playtesters and will help you keep track of when units have fired, moved, opportunity fired, with either secondary or primary weapons, and which units are Out of Command or Out of Supply.
132654.name: Death Ride Kursk: Command and Control and Fire Support Enhancements

132655.name: Acrobat Mission
132655.description:
Acrobat Mission is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up arcade game released by UPL in 1991, licensed to Taito for manufacture and distribution. It was ported to Nintendo Super Famicom in 1992.

In the year 2100, the Earth's environment is devastated by its inhabitants, who develop their space technology to live on Mars. Before they left, the humans created a Bio-Computer assigned to replenish Earth's ecosystem in hopes of returning to Earth. 50 years after terra-forming parts of Mars, the human colonists were attacked by mysterious, but hostile UFOs. The military leaders among the colonists set up an attack force to defend the colonists using state of the art fighter ships identified as the Icarus. The main operation of attack is called "Acrobat Mission" because it exceeds the technical flying ability of the pilots.
In the arcade version, surviving fighter pilots Jet and Nova are available for the player to choose for the rest of the game, but both were discluded from the Super Famicom port, making the player's pilot anonymous as well as discarding Nova's custom color scheme.
Here however is the story, exactly as it appears at the beginning of the game, with spelling and grammar mistakes preserved:
"AD 2100: HUMANS EXTERMINATED BY THEIR OWN NATURE DISTRUPTION AND ESCAPE TO MARS LEAVING BIO-COMPUTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL RECUPERATION OF EARTH. ONE DAY HALF A CENTURY AFTER HUMANS ARRIVED, MARS WAS ATTACKED BY STRANGE FLYING OBJECTES. TO FIGHT THESE ENEMIES, THE DIRECTOR-GENERAL OF THE DEFENCE AGENCY ORGANIZED THE TASK FORCE ARMY AND STARTED THE DOG FIGHT WITH INVADERS QUICLY. THE OPERATION WAS CALLED "ACROBAT MISSION" AS IT EXCEEDED THE PILOT'S TECHNICAL LIMIT."

Source: Wikipedia, "Acrobat Mission", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132656.name: Eador: Masters of the Broken World
132656.description:
Eador is a universe made of countless shards of land drifting in the Great Nothing. Each of the shards is a little world unto itself, with geography and denizens of its own. The power over the shards is bitterly contested by Masters, the immortal beings mortals believe to be gods.

Take the role of the mighty Master and shape the destiny of Eador! It is in your power to deliver the world from ultimate destruction – or to choke it with an iron fist of tyranny. Eador: Masters of the Broken World is a turn-based fantasy strategy game, where the decisions you make affect the world even deeper than the battles you win.

Key features:

- Balanced fusion of grand strategy, turn-based tactics and RPG elements;

- Boundless roleplaying opportunities;

- Massive selection of stratagems and ways to wage war;

- An intriguing, non-linear story;

- An original fantasy world, living a life of its own.

Source: The Game Website.

132657.description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Kickstarter project, where BoardGameGeek pledged $9,000 for the creation and distribution of two sets of promos, one of which is this unit promo (the other promo set is a terrain pack!). Many ideas came from BoardGameGeek users, many others were devised by Steve Jackson, and all were finalized by Steve.

Here are the unit descriptions straight from Steve Jackson himself!

Looking at the front, left to right, top to bottom:

FNRD the Ogre Ninja - This is the ONLY Ogre Ninja model that will be available in the first wave of Ogre units.

ERNIE the Mark VI - One of only three Mark VI models in the first wave; the others are both red, but ERNIE is in BGG colors, dark blue with orange.

Radio Tower - This was created especially for the BGG sheet, and is completely unique in this wave. It's intended as an objective - something really big to blow up.

BGG Strongpoint - Blue and orange, dug into a hill.

BGG-ZILLA - Drawn by Alex Fernandez. Suitable for all your giant monster needs!

BGG Command Post - Defend it with your life.

BGG Missile Crawler - Paneuro design, with a Paneuro insignia on it, but BGG colors. Created because BGG readers wanted a unit for "stop the runaway missile crawler!" scenarios.
132657.name: Ogre: BGG 3-D Units Sponsored Counter Sheet

132658.name: Awesomesauce The Roleplaying Game Trollhammer Edition
132658.description:
designer summary

It's finally here!

What started as an experimental Tweet by Mark Meredith grew into several blog posts, a few fan-created PocketMods, and finally was expanded by Paul Ingrassia, and became the subject of even more blogging.

Check out what all the excitement is about! It's the simplest RPG you're going to find, one number, one roll.

Further expanded and with new artwork, Awesomesauce Troll Hammer Edition puts the game in your hands, you decide how complex or simple you want your games to be. Both PocketMod and full-sized versions included, absolutely FREE!!!

It's amazing, astounding, astonishing, it's, it's...

AWESOMESAUCE!!!

Watch for further expansions and supplements in the future!

132659.name: Action Pachio
132659.description:
Action Pachio (アクションパチ夫) is a video game created by Coconuts Japan in 1993 for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System.
The player takes control of a white Pachio (Pachinko ball) and tries to make his way through all the side-scrolling levels. In between each level is a cut scene that updates the story for the player. Players can collect coins in the game; collecting 100 of them results in an extra life. They are also given a life bar with three different colors (symbolizing how "healthy" the character is), a time limit, and a relatively generic score indicator that goes up to 99 million points.

Source: Wikipedia, "Action Pachio", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132660.name: Seiken Psycho Caliber
132660.description:
User Summary

Seiken Psycho Caliber (Seiken means Holy Sword, possibly a reference to Excalibur) is an action RPG obviously inspired by The Legend of Zelda; the hero explores a fantasy world full of monsters and hidden treasure to rescue a fairy princess, and the sprites, animations, and screen transitions all work in a manner very similar to Zelda. One way that Seiken Psycho Caliber is different from its predecessor is that the hero has to eat regularly to stay in fighting condition.

Seiken Psycho Caliber was part of Imagineer's Wave Jack program, which included extra media to immerse the player into the game world. SPC's materials included maps, a notebook, and an audio cassette.

132661.name: bit Dungeon
132661.description:
User Summary

A top down dungeon crawler. Kill enemies, find keys, get new weapons and armor and try to find your wife. Explore as much of the dungeon as you can, and if you die you will have to start over.

132662.name: Spike - A Love Story
132662.description:
User Summary

You are a spike trap in love with a guy who runs past everyday. How will you show your love? The only way you know how, by crushing him.

132663.name: Frankensplit
132663.description:
User Summary

A one button game with a twist. The screen is split in two and you must help Frankenstein's monster reach the exit in both half. Clicking the button causes the monster to jump. Avoid obstacles, jump on to platforms and head toward the door.

132664.name: Gloop
132664.description:
A meteor crashed down upon the world releasing a primordial slime upon the world. The slime showed signs of limited intelligence like that of a K9. So you have taken it upon yourself to protect and raise the little creature.

Gloop is a 1-3 player game where you fight off Hostile slime eating monsters, while tending to the needs that Gloop may have, to complete a hidden goal that will come up later. You accomplish this by accomplishing each event that turns out over the course of the game. They range from hostiles that want to eat Gloop to satisfying Gloops current mood by doing what the card asks of you. The goal must be accomplished before the event deck runs out for you to be victorious.

132665.name: Out of Wind
132665.description:
User Summary

A village relies on the wind for power, but the wind has stopped. You must place gears to get the turbines moving again.

132666.name: Isaki Shuugorou no Keiba Hisshou Gaku
132666.description:
User Summary

A horse racing game released in Japan in 1990.

132667.name: Running Amok
rpgseries: CORE - Living Forgotten Realms Core Adventures
132667.description:
From the front page of the PDF:

For years the tenuous peace between Netheril and Cormyr held. For years the city of Urmlaspyr, last remnant of free Sembia, lay in between. Now something stirs in the darkest places of the city. Citizens run amok without apparent cause, wielding shadow powers they did not have before. What could cause these otherwise peaceful people to fly into a murderous frenzy? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Urmlaspyr for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10).

This adventure is part of Chapter 1 of the Desolation series. Chapter 1 includes four Heroic tier adventures leading up to the conclusion in CORE5-1. The other three parts are SPEC4-5, CORE4-4, and CORE4-5. You can play these four adventures in any order, but you should try to play them with the same character, and you should try to play all four parts before you play CORE5-1. The Desolation series also includes Paragon tier adventures (starting with SPEC4-6). It is not expected that a player can follow both tracks with the same PC.

132668.name: Who's Who or Food for Thought
boardgameversion: M.P. Topical War Card Game Edition
132668.description:
A very rare card game from around 1940.

There are 18 sets of three cards per set. When a set is complete, the first card will say a war-time real person's name. The second card will have a short rhyme without the last word and that word appears on the third card in the set (all the last words are illustrated by a food item, hence the name of the game). An example;
General Gort (1st card)
With his army in France, just in CASE,
Our French pals need help to hold Nazis in (both lines 2nd card)
PLAICE (3rd card)

Sets like this help to date the game because France had not fallen at the time of printing. And other sets help as well. Neville Chamberlain was still Prime Minister for instance.

The game mechanic is very much like Rummy card games. You draw and discard cards until you get a set. This is laid before you. The same applies to a second set but now you would be out of cards in your hand so then you have to spend three turns just drawing a new card each time. Once you are up to three cards in your hand, you can collect properly again.

Each set has a point value on the card. In general, the British named character sets are worth between 10 and 20 points. The German characters are worth between 5 or 10 points. Hitler is 10, Goering only 5, for example. You might find it strange that Chamberlain is worth 20 but Churchill only 15. Churchill was not Prime Minister at the time of publication so was not worth the 20 you might have expected.

The round ends when one player has three completed sets. That player collects the point value of each set (the rest score nothing) and a game will last until one player achieves a set score agreed upon at the start. The rules suggest 100 to 200 points.

132669.description:
From the back of the book:

Boxer Rebellion: Admiral Seymour's Relief Attempt features 10 action-packed historical scenarios from the first phase of the Boxer Rebellion. Fanatical Boxers, The Chinese Imperial Army and a train bound Allied force battle it out on the way to Peking. Also featured are three scenarios from pre-European involvement where the Chinese Army tried to suppress the growing Boxer movement.

The scenarios:
1. Senlou Temple - October 18, 1899 Chinese Army vs. Boxers
2. Laishui Boxing Grounds - May 16, 1900 Chinese Army vs. Boxers
3. Boxer Revenge - May 18, 1900 Chinese Army vs. Boxers
4. Skirmish on the Rails - June 11, 1900
5. Anting Station - June 13, 1900
6. The Relief of Lofa Station - June 14, 1900
7. Cracker Guns - June 20, 1900
8. General Nieh's Pursuit - June 21, 1900
9. The Battle of Peitsang - June 21, 1900
10. Hsiku Arsenal - June 22, 1900

These scenarios are organized to be played using The Sword and the Flame, but can easily be adapted to any rules set. Units are set at 8 figures instead of the traditional 20. This allows for faster play, greater flexibility and ... your 20-figure units become 2½ units instantly! All scenarios are played ona 4x6' table. Give it a try!

Other sections include:
- Uniform inforamtion
- History of the period!
- Information on the Chinese and European Forces
132669.name: Colonial Campaigns: Admiral Seymour's Relief Attempt

132671.name: Twin Draughts
132671.description:
It's a variant of Draughts. Changes from the standard game:
1) Jumping over: when an opponent's piece is jumped over, either man or king, the player who made the move picks it up and replaces it in a free square at his choice, but of the opposite color. At the beginning, all pieces are positioned as usual on black squares, but in the following the game evolves in two parallel plays. Those plays are interconnected, since a “capture” made on squares of a color moves the jumped piece on a square of the opposite color. On his turn, a player can choose to move a piece either on the white or on the black squares. All the other movement rules remain the same.
2)Promotion: as in the standard game, a man is promoted to king when it reaches the opponent's kings row. The player that gained the promotion must choose one of his other men, remove it from the game and place it on top of the promoted piece. Each promotion makes a king from a pair of men, reducing in that way the overall number of pieces on the board.
3) Goal and scoring: the game is won by the first player that promotes all his men to kings. Each player will score one point for each king he has at the end of the game. A match should be composed of an even number of games, to be started alternately by the players. The winner is the player with the highest overall score.

132672.name: Celestial Order Magic
132672.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Wind of Azyr flows across the sky, touching the minds and thoughts of all who gaze upon the stars. Astromancers, Celestial Wizards who use the wind of Azyr, are renowned seers able to see and even perhaps manipulate the future. Will you join them?

Celestial Order Magic is a Print on Demand expansion for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay that features new spells for all ranks for wizards of the Celestial College! Gaze upon the stars to divine or even manipulate the future, or call down lightning bolts and meteor storms to smite your enemies!

Celestial Order Magic is a 20-card POD pack, consisting of:

15 Action Cards
2 Item Cards
3 Rules Cards

132674.name: Bingo Pinball Boardgame
132674.description:
Using direction dice you will be trying to shoot five balls into numbered holes on the playfield. They will light corresponding numbers on the backglass. Try to get 3, 4, or 5 numbers in a row on the backglass cards.

Numbers must be ADJOINING each other connected by a line. Only highest score per card registers.

Coin 1: 5 balls on card 1

Play as many (or as few) coins as you wish.

Coins 2 - 6: lites Cards 2 thru 6.

Coins 7 and 8: lites Diagonals on Cards 1, 2, 3 and Cards 4, 5, 6.

Coins 9 and 10: lites a Magic Number for Cards 1, 2, 3 and Cards
4, 5, 6. Hitting the Magic Number will DOUBLE the odds on those cards.

Coin 11: lites DOUBLE-DOUBLE payoff on one card. Hitting the Magic Number will DOUBLE-DOUBLE the odds on that card.

Coin 12: lites ALL PLAYFIELD SCORES. Now, if you make 3, 4, or 5 adjoining holes on any one row ON THE PLAYFIELD, you score as indicated on the 3rd card.

Coin 13: lites PLAYFIELD SCORES. Now 14, 15, 16, 17, 18 score as 5 in-line, and 23, 24, 25 score as 4 in-line. You score as indicated on the 6th card.

Coins 14 and above: increases the odds on each card in turn, or lites a feature like '4 corners score as 5 in-line' or a SUPER LINE. (SUPER LINE scores 2 in-line as 3, 3 in-line as 4, 4 in-line as 5). Or, a coin might lite a playfield button to lite the CORNERS or SUPER LINE feature.

After playing the 13th coin, you may (if you wish) play another coin and lite the Golden Star Game. Each coin increases the Golden Star Game odds. A maximum of 20 coins may be played. When lit, after shooting your first ball, five gold numbers will lite in a star pattern on one of the cards. Any 2, 3 or 4 in the Golden Star will score as indicated.

After shooting the fifth ball, you may try to improve your game with 1 to 3 EXTRA BALLS. The maximum payoff on the next ball is shown, as well as the cost of an EXTRA BALL. (The higher the potential win, the greater the cost).

132675.name: Stack-o-Saurus Card Game
132675.description:
From the publisher:
Get your dino game on with Stack-o-Saurus; a card game that's not only a cinch to learn but that's different every time you play! Be the first to crack the code of stacking dinosaurs ... the winner is the first player to complete a Dino Tower. However players need to watch out for T-Rex since he can topple your tower in no time!

48 jumbo cards.

132677.name: Ambassador: England
132677.description:
Trivia and chance game! Play as an ambassador of an European country and answer questions correctly to win the appreciation of the English Ambassador. The game is available as open source and can be modified to your discretion.

It is a similar take on trivial pursuit, where one must roll the dice and then move to a spot where you can pick a question card and answer it. Correctly answering it, earns you a token and you turn in points for tokens at the English Ambassador square, at the centre of the board. You win be either being ahead by 5 points or having the most points after answering all questions. Tokens do not count as points. If there is a tie in points at the end of the game, then a random question card will be drawn and the best with the fastest correct answer, wins. Otherwise, another question card will be drawn until there is a winner. Only the players in a tie are eligible to answer the question.

132679.name: Flip Flop Pikku Myy
132679.description:
Flip Flop Pikku Myy (Little My / Moomin character) is a childrens game where the aim of the game is to collect cards by throwing the Little My game pieces.

On a turn player places all the Little My pieces (two sided head, torso, hands, legs and feet pieces) in a dice cup, shakes them up and tips the pieces on the table. Once pieces have been thrown player arranges the pieces to form a picture of Little My.

Player then compares the picture formed by the pieces and three open Little My cards on the table and if there's a match (colors and facial expression) player collects the card. If there's no match, player can select pieces and rethrow them twice. After the third toss it's next players turn.

Game ends when a player has collected 7 cards.

132681.name: Penis Goes Where?
132681.description:
From the designer:

Many LARPs over the years have used card games to simulate sex, but all of them have been somewhat... unfulfilling. For that reason, I present this simple to play yet difficult to master sex mechanic for two or more interested people.

Penis Goes Where is © 1 April 2009 Michael Young and is released into the public domain under a Creative Commons Share Alike License. Feel free to copy and distribute but contact me if you want to publish this for money for some unfathomable reason.

132683.name: TrucKing
132683.description:
Players travel across a map of 24 North American cities connected by highways in a race to deliver goods to every city before his/her opponents.

Every city has a limited supply of one type of six unique goods, but that same city demands two others-and the two goods change with every delivery. Players earn money for delivering the requested goods, but the journey isn't without costs, which must be effectively managed to save up for truck upgrades which allow you to transport more goods. The more cities you visit, the more bonus points you earn at game's end. There's also an additional bonus for being the first to visit a city. Six of the cities are in Canada, which presents its own unique challenge as carrying goods across the border requires paying a tariff. Each city, one by one, is randomly designated as a bonus city during the game, earning the first delivery driver to reach that city a bonus payout.

Who will manage their deliveries most efficiently and score the victory? Buckle up and hit the road!

132684.description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 12-14 October 2012.

Consists of Shub-Niggurath, a new Ancient One.
132684.name: Elder Sign: Arkham Nights 2012 Promotional Ancient One Card

132685.name: Letterpress
videogamehonor: 2013 Apple Design Awards Best Overall Design of the Year Winner
132685.description:
Find words, steal tiles, color the board! Letterpress is a fresh new word game for iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch. Play with your friends using Game Center! The perfect blend of fun and strategy. Download it for free on the App Store.

Source: The Game Website.

132686.name: Stone's Throw
132686.description: Players roll 9 dice, attempting to roll combinations (e.g., seven 5s). Successful completion of combinations earns the right to reroll dice on future turns to complete harder combinations. Certain combinations also award gems that are collected and later sold for victory points. The value of the gems decrease as the game goes on. Additional bonuses are won for being the first to sell sets of gems-larger sets earn more victory points.

132687.name: Down the Line
132687.description:
Players fill a grid of 16 squares with randomly-selected numbered tiles. Each grid square has a color assigned to it; only tiles matching that color may be played in that square.

Each row and column must have all 4 numbered tiles in descending order before a row can be scored. These tiles are saved for scoring at game's end. Any cleared row or column is reset with a new color pattern for its 4 squares, and may be filled again.

132688.name: Rain, Sand, Stars
132688.description:
User Summary

You control a rain god, Tsuyu, who is tasked with returning water to a barren corner of the galaxy. With your powers you can make clouds spring to life and spout forth water. But make sure to avoid the dangerous denizens of the planets you are trying to save!

The game is played on a series of worlds. When you reach a copse of desiccated trees, you can rejuvenate them by holding a finger on the screen, causing rain to fall.

132689.name: ICONS Bonus Rogues Gallery
132689.description:
User summary:

A collection of villains for use with ICONS originally made available for individuals placing pre-orders for the core book.

132690.name: Book of Heroes
132690.description:
In the sleepy village of Glenfort, a great evil is awakening.
A hero will rise to meet it — will that hero be you?

FEATURES

Gather your closest allies into powerful guilds to reap huge rewards while collectively participating in raids and challenges!
Compete against other guilds for Power and Prestige!
Now featuring integrated chat, mail and forums!
Explore the decaying land of Fellmarsh and confront a source of great evil!
Complete quests and defeat powerful enemies to save your home and stop an ancient evil from taking over the world!
Customize your hero from the ground up — choose your face, gender, hair style and more!
Specialize in one of three classes — the powerful Justicar, stealthy Shadow Walker, or the wise War Mage!
Outfit your hero with thousands of unique equipment options, each one affecting their appearance!
Battle an army of beautifully-rendered hand-painted foes in fun RPG-inspired combat!
Take on powerful bosses to earn rare equipment and valuable loot!
Complete over 100 unique quests!
Achieve over 50 different Feats of Heroism to increase your Hero Score!
Use Friend Codes to share progress with your friends, view their heroes, and compete for the highest Hero Score in all the land!




Source: The Game Website.

132691.name: Dash Race
132691.description:
Steering, speeding up, braking, cutting, blocking: who is the smartest driver in this strategic racing game, leaving his opponents behind and passing the finishing line first?

Dash Race is the electronic version of a popular turn-based paper game that can be played everywhere at anytime, because all you need is a sheet of squared paper and colored pencils - or Dash Race for even more fun and challenges.

Up to four players make their moves in turns, following very simple rules. This results in an amazingly realistic driving behavior. In order to take curves at optimal speed, you'll need experience and dexterity. Play the pure and truly timeless strategic variant in "Classic Mode", or turn to the breathtaking "Challenge Mode" for a wild arcade-style Dash Race.


Up to four players on one or multiple devices
Gamecenter, Bluetooth & WiFi connections available to play with multiple devices locally and around the world
A training course will interactively introduce you to the secrets of Dash Race and prepare you for races against others
Climb up global Dash Race leaderboards in Gamecenter
Prove your skills by earning various Gamecenter achievements
Additional Robot-opponents with adjustable driving skills can be joined into a race
Easy and intuitive game handling
Comprehensive statistics: view all the details of your last races and of the previous winners
Differently challenging tracks
Different background grids, requiring distinctive driving strategies - or make the grid invisible for an additional challenge
More tracks can be downloaded from a growing selection of attractive track packages
Upload your completed races to your Facebook wall or send your successes straight to your Twitter account


Source: The Game Website.

132692.name: 4 Elements II
132692.description:
Misfortune has befallen the magic kingdom again! A careless charm made the formerly wondrous ancient world overcast, beset with darkness and despair. Four fairies of the elements were deprived of their magic power. Be the hero the kingdom seeks: set the fairies of earth, air, fire and water free, and restore the book of magic!


4 adorable fairies of the elements to set free
16 magic cards to collect
64 unique match-3 levels + 32 bonus levels
4 exciting quests to complete
iSpy, spot-the-difference and other types of mini-games
Various achievements to get


Source: The Game Website.

132693.name: Unicorn Rush
132693.description:
UNICORN RUSH IS A FUN & ADDICTIVE GAME OF SPEED!
Take flight through the night skies as a powerful and magical Unicorn!


Jump confidently from one floating island to the next and avoid plummeting into the icy waters below.
Shoot Magic Fireballs to shatter rocks and crystals that get in your way!
Pick up Magic Mushrooms to cast temporary spells to help you on your quest!
Collect Unicoins as you run, then use them in the Magic Shop to permanently enhance your magical powers!


Source: The Game Website.

132694.name: Kumo Lumo
132694.description:
Use rain to grow forests and douse fires, and use a bolt of lightning to zap enemies intent on ruining Kumo Lumo’s world. Featuring a unique artistic style and delightfully simple gameplay, you won’t be able to get enough of Kumo Lumo!

Game Features

Kumo Lumo marries unique artwork with a completely new genre—the rain ‘em up!
Use torrents of rain as well as devastating lightning bolts on the environment and those who inhabit it.
A blast for gamers of every age, Kumo Lumo delivers great gameplay for everyone.
Comical animations and a super sense of style.
Universal; plays great on iPhone, iPod touch and iPad.




Source: The Game Website.

132695.name: Space Station: Frontier
132695.description:
You are the Overseer of a deep space mining operation, scouring the farthest reaches of the Solar System for valuable resources.

It would be a peaceful job but for one thing: a vicious, mysterious alien race is violently contesting your claim to this territory.

Now, as you harvest precious energy, you must also fortify your station, build up your firepower and defend humanity's domain on this new frontier!

Features

Construct weaponry and mining tools using an intuitive tower defense style interface.
Design and power vast networks of structures, then defend them against alien incursion!
Earn upgrades and unlocks for your space station to increase its power and abilities!
Enjoy the story-based campaign mode where you are humanity's last chance for survival.
Play one of the freeform, endless modes and compete with other players worldwide using the online leaderboards.
Mission mode provides quick tactical challenges. Beat a scenario to earn achievements!
Full OpenFeint integration provides multiple user profiles, complete offline support, online scores and lots achievements to earn.
Awesome music & sound effects by Earcom!




Source: The Game Website.

132696.name: Das Sonnenscheinspiel
132696.description:
Curious little game in that it is not boxed and comes in a ziplock bag.

The board has 12 coloured spaces and on each space a counter is placed of the same colour. Depending on the number of players, each player gets an equal area featuring these counters.

The game is simple. Throw the dice with the colours on it. If you roll a colour in your area, you may remove the counter (it goes out of the game) or you can move that counter into an opponent's area if he has a space of that colour without a counter on it. There is some strategy required by the little ones who will play this game and that is a good thing in my opinion.

The winner is the first player to clear out all the counters in his area.

132697.name: MafiaDollar promo card pack
132697.description:
A pack of promotional cards for MafiaDollar i.e. a five card mini expansion: an item, a warehouse card, an event and two loot cards.

The only new rule concernes the loot cards. These cards are only scored if one player has both.

132698.name: The Sidereal Schemes of Dr. Zodiac
132698.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adamant Entertainment presents, available publicly for the first time, the first adventure for ICONS: Superpowered Roleplaying, written by ICONS designer Steve Kenson!

The Sidereal Schemes of Doctor Zodiac was a bonus adventure released with the initial pre-order of the ICONS core rules two years ago, and is intended as an introductory adventure, getting your friends right into the action of playing the roles of superheroes safeguarding Our Fair City from the terrible threat posed by Dr. Zodiac!

132699.name: Public Enemies
132699.description:
From publisher blurb:

To all law enforcement agencies: this confidential profile of offenders incarcerated in USHER's Rock City facility is provided in case of escape.

These criminals are superhumanly powerful and should not be approached without assistance from USHER, the Crown Guard, Aegis or the New Coalition.

After these agenices have been notified, assist in clearing civilians from the area and setting up a perimeter.

The current population of Rock City includes:

Armory: a mutant weapons master further enhanced by alien energy weapons
Atrocity: a tragic legacy of World War II, this horror was further enhanced with modern science during the dark days of the Scion Invasion.
Brainstorm: heir to a great legacy of wealth and heroism, this so-called "smartest man alive" believes he alone should rule the Earth
Garrote: able to slip under any door, this superhuman hit man has given humself many names, most of them silly, including "the elastic assassin" and "the human noose" but his glib banter hides a cold-hearted killer
Equinox: this team of genetically modified children killed their father and took control of Equinox Industries before embarking on a brief but terrible killing spree
Ground Zero: a living atomic bomb that has to explode every 48 hours if not contained, in addition to USHER personnel contact FEMA immediately if sighted
The Hollow Men: these time travelers are the most dangerous villain team in the world and their mission, to "save" the Earth by reducing its population by at least 90% is almost too terrible to contemplate
Omega: perhaps the world's deadliest assassin, this killer seems to care only for money
Overtone: a being of pure sound, this mad scientist will try to convince you that he is a hero but do not approach, engage or allow the subject to assist law enforcement
Shillelagh: this extra-dimensional conquerer seeks to return to the Earth to its "rightful" rulers, the Fey
