Ninja warriors Jack and Ryu must help the people of Futureland defeat the alien overlords by creating a spaceship from scratch. Despite their intentions, Ryu and Jack must land at all the planets in order to repair the spaceship.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja Boy II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132887.name: A Song of Sixpence
132887.description:
From the Introduction:

In this short adventure the players take on the roles of a band of bards known as "The Beholders".

For the last 99 years, the town of Frog's Hollow has held its annual All Hallows' Eve Ball, an extravagant and exclusive affair. This year marks the 100th anniversary of the acclaimed event. Everyone who's anyone will be in attendance.

Each year the town's planning committee gathers together to decide on the entertainment for that year. For the last 3 years, Lord Callus of Montello has tried to persuade them to allow his son, Beeb Montello, to receive that coveted honor. Alas, the committee has high standards, and could not be persuaded to grant the arrogant man-child the nomination. After all, it seemed to them that the boy was more concerned with primp than song!

This year, the year of the 100th All Hallows' Eve Ball, Lord Callus will not be ignored. Taking matters into his own hands, he has hired an Oracle by the name of Alagar Greyskut to make sure his son sings at the Ball. Greyskut has received a lofty sum to see this task through, and he means to succeed. His first plan of action is to make sure that the musicians who are supposed to play the Ball don't show up. "The Beholders" haven't a clue just how hard this gig is going to be!

132888.description: Part of the 2012 Salmon Run Kickstarter campaign, The Grizzly Bear Expansion limited edition card that allows you to move a bear up to 2 hexes. Each salmon in the same hex must discard 2 cards at random.
132888.name: Salmon Run: The Grizzly Bear

132889.name: NFL Quarterback Club (Game Boy)
132889.description:
NFL Quarterback Club for Game Boy doe snot let you play a regular game of football, but instead offers a quarterback challenge. Choose one of 13 quarterbacks, and face off one on one against the others in four different drills that will test things like speed and accuracy. Beat each competitor to move on to the next one.

- User Summary

132890.description:
The Bald Eagle is a Kickstarter exclusive card for backers of the 2012 Salmon Run. This cards text reads:

"Choose a hex. Each salmon that occupies that hex must randomly discard a card from their hand."
132890.name: Salmon Run: The Bald Eagle

132891.description:
Part of the 2012 Salmon Run Kickstarter campaign, The Fisherman Board is an additional double sided board for Salmon Run.

From the designer: "This additional board introduces an exciting new obstacle, Fisherman! While salmon are free to move onto the Fishermen hex (designated with a Hook symbol) there is a chance of them getting caught! The player rolls the die, on an odd roll they are hooked and cannot move until they play two swim cards to free themselves. "
132891.name: Salmon Run: The Fisherman Board

132892.name: Prawn 2
132892.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uses the same GM rules found in PRAWN, including the schedule. Use these characters to create a whole new game. Also includes two "handouts."

From Introduction:

PRAWN 1 was set in a restaurant. PRAWN 2 is set in a pet shop. Keep this in mind.
Set up the Tank as in PRAWN, with the following changes:

Fishing pole in corner. The fishing pole should be a long piece of waterproof material with a rope tied to the end. It needs a large, “metal” fish hook. I’d suggest something made of plastic or foam covered in duct tape. Don’t use actual metal or a real fish hook. Keep it safe.
Sunken ship at bottom of Tank. Instead of a treasure chest, the Tank has a sunken ship at the bottom of it. This can just be described to the players if you don’t happen to have a sunken ship prop handy.
Starfish hanging in corner of room. This is the same Starfish as PRAWN, but it has a different purpose.

132893.description:
Part of the 2012 Salmon Run Kickstarter campaign, Salmon Run: The Fork/Cataract Falls adds another double sided board to Salmon Run.

The Fork: features a fork in the river.

Cataract Falls: features water falls.
132893.name: Salmon Run: The Fork/Cataract Falls Board

132894.name: NFL Quarterback Club II
132894.description:
A football simulation game featuring the NFL league.

- User Summary

132895.name: Prawn 3
132895.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uses the same rules and mechanics as PRAWN, but is in an entirely different setting with its own timeline. Includes 20 all new characters loosely based on characters from the Brassy's Men Campaign. PRAWN 3 is a complete standalone game, and you don't need to be familiar with "Brassy's Men" to run or play it.

From Introduction:

This is a random collection of notes for PRAWN 3. It does not explain how to run a PRAWN game or the combat mechanics. Those are in PRAWN 1 and readily available there.

You will need:

Many pieces of flotsam. They are listed as parts in the packet stuffing list below. There are 142 points worth of parts stuffed into character packets. You should have about 20-30 more points worth of flotsam available to throw into the pool as needed (and as stashes).
Hit Points. We use gummy bracelets now instead of keychains. There are 148 hit points in the game.
Bottles of alcohol. We suggest those plastic “airline” bottles filled with potable water.

132896.name: NFL Quarterback Club 96
132896.description:
NFL Quarterback Club '96 is an American football video game released in December 1995. The game was released on the Sega Saturn, Sega Genesis, Game Boy,] Sega Game Gear,] DOS, and Super Nintendo Entertainment System. The game's cover features San Francisco 49ers quarterback Steve Young passing while being tackled by Chicago Bears defensive lineman Chris Zorich and an unidentified defender. The Saturn and SNES versions were developed by Iguana Entertainment, while the Game Boy edition was developed by Condor Inc.

The game has 32 offensive plays and 16 defensive plays. The simulation modes include Preseason, Playoffs and Season, where you play a season of 18 games. Another playable mode is the Quarterback Challenge, where players take control of a quarterback and compete against other quarterbacks in the league in various competitions, such as distance, mobility, obstacle, and accuracy. Players can save their game via passcodes. As the game has the National Football League license, all 30 teams are represented in the game, and players can perform transactions between teams, as well as player substitutions. The game also features the no huddle offense, three camera angles, penalties, three possible clock speeds, weather conditions, player reports, replays, and pre-game shows.

Source: Wikipedia, "NFL Quarterback Club '96", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132897.name: Nemesis
132897.description:
The first Gradius for a portable system, in this case Nintendo's Game Boy. The name Nemesis was kept for the game's worldwide release. It combined elements from Gradius and Gradius 2 (the MSX versions), as well as some all-new features.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gradius", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132898.name: Navy Seals
132898.description:
Navy SEALS is a 1990 run and gun video game developed and published by Ocean. It is based on the movie of the same name. The game loosely follows the plot of the movie and consists of 5 side scrolling levels. The player takes the role of Lt. Dale Hawkins progressing through each level armed with a handgun. A machinegun is available to pickup as are special sniper bonuses which clear the whole screen of terrorists.

Source: Wikipedia, "Navy SEALS (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132899.name: Resurrection Mary
132899.description:
From the Introduction:

This game is for 4 players.

Our story takes place with the following characters that will need to be played: three young adult males (the Trio), who are winding down a long weekend night at 1AM on an empty road on the way back from a burrito run, and one Resurrection Mary... a hitchhiker of unknown origin that somehow knows a little too much about the Trio.

132900.description: Part of the 2012 Salmon Run Kickstarter campain, the Salmon Run: 5th Player Expansion adds the components necessary to play a 5 player game of Salmon Run.
132900.name: Salmon Run: The 5th Player Expansion

132901.name: Storychips: Medieval Fantasy
132901.description:
From the Introduction:

Have you ever watched a movie or read a book and wondered what stats the characters would have when they would be characters from your favourite RPG? Or have you ever wondered that your RPG character cannot do the things he should be able to do because you learned the wrong skills in the beginning? If you answered one or both questions with yes than storytelling-RPGs like Storychips might have something to offer for you. The general idea is that the players describe what they like to do and that they succeed if they can convince the gamemaster that they can do what they want to do and/or that it is good for the story if they have success.

There is one problem that can arise with these storytelling games: If everybody can do everything he can explain good enough than it is not really a game but rather creative "writing" in a group. This does not have to be a bad thing. Telling stories to each other or making up stories together is a great pastime but if you want to have a "real" game you have to add something else. In the case of Storychips the storychips are this little something. In chapter 2 I will explain how they work.

132902.name: Quick and Dirty Space Combat Game
132902.description:
A quick and dirty space combat game.
Finished but in Alpha.

QDSCG uses basic ideas and concepts, with generalized fire power, but there is still the interplay of missiles, fighters, and direct combat. Abstraction is the key, but the system has the ability to open up to allow easy rule changes.

Using simple rules, no tables, no off board record keeping, the games is designed to allow masses space combat of fleet scale engagements take place with in a short play time of 1-2 hours. Larger engagements between teams could easily be taught and played at a convention with a simple cheat sheet keeping track of all rules.

132904.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers: Dynomite Duos
132904.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from yore to use in your games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 5 sets of Dynamite Duos to use in your Supers! from Beyond Belief Games. The art is original, and the text for each hero was adapted from the Public Domain Supers website.

132905.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 02: The Black Terror's Friends and Foes
132905.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the dyas of yore to use in your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 heroes and villians to use in your next Supers! from Beyong Belief game.

Included in this set is:

The Black Terror - the invulnerable caped crime fighter
Tim Terror - the side kick of Black Terror
Red Ann - a mysterious woman viaing vengence forthe past
Bo Briantus - a 98th century chemist
Dr. Fission - the man who made time travel possible
Puzzler - a puzzled young man who turned to crime
Dr. Ghoul - a monster creating mad man
Kroll Mull - a devilish dream making dictator
Lady Serpent - the serpentous seductrous
Torch - a fire welding wielder

132906.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 03: The Captains Vol. 1
132906.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the dyas of yore to use in your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! whose names includes the prefix of CAPTAIN.

Included in this set is:

Captain Atom (Charlton version)
Captain Atom (Nationwide version)
Captain Combat
Captain Commando
Captain Courageous
Captain Fearless
Captain Fight
Captain Future
Captain Midnight
Captain Valiant

132907.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 04: Super Americans
132907.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore into your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! who are Patriotic Visions of the United States of America.

Included in this set are:

American Crusader
Commando Yank
Fighting Yank
Captain Flag
Captain Freedom
Eagle
American Eagle
Cadet
Major Victory
Shield

132908.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 05: Golden Ghosts
132908.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! who have either "Golden" or "Ghost" in their name.

Included in this set are:

Golden Arrow, Golden Archer, Ghost (nedor), Ghost (Lev Gleason), Ghost Woman, Ghost of Flanders, Golden Girl, Golden Knight, Green Ghost, Golden Eagle,

132909.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 06: Strong Men and Women
132909.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! who rely on their brains and brawn to defeat evil.

Included in this set are:

Serpent Queen, Moon Girl, Mister Scarlet, Magno (Ace), Magno (Quality), Minute Man, Iron Lady, Panther Woman, Tomboy, and Phantom Lady

132910.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 07
132910.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Baroness Blood, Captain Nazi, Duke of Darkness, Black Axeman, Ranger Girl, Fu Chang, Green Lama, Lash Lightining, Super Brain, and Madame Satan.

132911.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 08: Heroes and Villains
132911.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Dr. Diabole, Dr. Dracula, Dr. Diamond, Black Death, Star Dust, Black Dragon, Eel, Steel Sterling, Fireball, and the Deaglos

132912.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 09: Heroes and Villains
132912.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Amazing Man, Der Hyena, Amazona, Ant Queen, Great Question, The Claw, Air Man, Black Phantom, Brain Men of Mars, and Dr. Martinious

132913.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 10
132913.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 10 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Superfiend, Algie, Power Nelson, Gorvak, Beauty, Doll Man, War Nurse, Blue Lady, Sceptre, and Gimp

132914.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 11
132914.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 9 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Red Rube, Billy Bounce, Brain Master, Bouncer, Crystal Queen, Boss, Crystal, Manx, and Bunny

132915.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 12
132915.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 9 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Baron Doom, Beast, Crimson Cobra, Funnibone, Bird Man, Scarlet Skull, The Thinker, Brick Bat, and Crimson Claw

132916.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 13
132916.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes 9 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Black Bat, Bela Jat, Big Shot, Bee, Brother, Dr. Bio, Blyntzyns, Lava Man, Oom the Great

132917.name: Supers! Public Domain Supers 14
132917.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the superheroes from the days of yore to your SUPERS! games. This edition of Public Domain supers includes the write up and a full body image for 5 Supers! both heroes and villains.

Included in this set are:

Atlas, Ace of Blades, Ace of Spades, Animal Man and Bullfrog

132918.name: Ape Shoot
132918.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players will face not one, but two villains in this adventure set in the Metropolverse* setting. First they face the wise cracking Puzzler, only to find themselves face to face with the infamous Groddilla (a large green ape who is determined to over throw the specietocracy of the Humans!) However, before dealing with this sinister simian your players will have to work their way through some twists and complication of a few Sub Plots.

Also included with this adventure are the graphics files for Groddilla. You get him in 4 different graphics formats in both black and white to use in your creative endeavours as you wish, just make sure my signature stays on the picture.


This is the town that broke Time and Space for in Metropolverse ALL REALITIES EXIST AT ONCE.

132919.name: Bugged Out
132919.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the next adventure for Supers! from Beyond Belief Games. In this adventure your heroes must face a colossal pest problem before they eat the town. Along the way they must tangle with a sinister seductrous and deal with the various problems that plague every hero at one time or another. The final show down is a bug of another sort that threatens to keep the city ground under the feet of insects. Can your heroes prevail?

This adventure is written in three acts, contains stats for 2 villains, and also includes the graphics files for the final villain (that is 1 image in 4 different graphics formats!)

132920.name: The Kick Inside Player's Booklet
132920.description:
From the introduction:

The Kick Inside is a scenario about different stages in life and how we cope with changes. Mayor themes are identity, choices and acceptance.

We get to meet four people - Agnes, Marcus, Olivia and Thomas - and follow them through three different stages in life. Three parallell, sepa- rate stories, each running through four acts. All stories take place in cabins that are curiously alike.

This is the Players Booklet. Each player needs one. If you want to you can access this booklet at any time during the game but you do not need to know it by heart. The important thing is not to get all nuances right but for you to explore your character.

132921.name: The Kick Inside Game Master's Booklet
132921.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Kick Inside is a scenario about different stages in life and how we cope with changes. Major themes are identity, choice and acceptance.

We get to meet four people—Agnes, Marcus, Olivia and Thomas—and follow them through three different stages in life. Three parallell, separate stories, each running through four acts. All stories take place in cabins that are curiously alike.

In difference to most jeepform games, The Kick Inside is very larp-like, in this case meaning that most events occur in real-time, and in parallel, rather than focussed on a single event at each point in time.

132922.name: The Kick Inside Floorsheets
132922.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Kick Inside is a scenario about different stages in life and how we cope with changes. Major themes are identity, choice and acceptance.

We get to meet four people—Agnes, Marcus, Olivia and Thomas—and follow them through three different stages in life. Three parallell, separate stories, each running through four acts. All stories take place in cabins that are curiously alike.

In difference to most jeepform games, The Kick Inside is very larp-like, in this case meaning that most events occur in real-time, and in parallel, rather than focussed on a single event at each point in time.

User Contribution:

These are printable markers to label areas in the play space.

132923.name: Living Dead
rpgpodcastepisode: Master Plan #59: Jason Morningstar & Steve Segedy on Building Fiasco Playsets
132923.description:
From the publisher's website:

Everything has changed. No more paperwork or errands or ballgames. We still fight and squabble and lie as much as ever, but not for money or drugs or power. When the world has been overrun by the living dead, survival is the only thing that matters. Banding together always seems like a good idea in theory; strength in numbers, right? Keep believing that if you want, but those people just might kill you before the zombies. Remember, only one thing matters: staying alive.

To be clear, this supplement is an add-on, designed to be used with another playset. Zombies in a nice southern town? Perfect. Zombies in the Old West? Of course! Zombies on the grassy knoll? Oswald is the least of Kennedy’s problems.

132924.name: The Wisdom of Ravens
132924.description:
From the introduction:

This is a story game in which you and some friends will create a short story in about an hour.

Once all the players are together, pick one person to be the human player, who will make up and control a person with a serious problem. Everyone else will take the roles of magically intelligent ravens who like to fix problems. The other players will also play incidental characters.

The story will be created improvisationally, with a scene being set, and everyone subsequently describing what their character says and does.

132925.name: Magneter och mirakel
132925.description:
Publisher blurb (in Swedish):

Världen håller på att förändras. Vättarna under bergen förser människorna med teknologi de blir allt mer beroende av, men människorna finner också egna sätt att bruka jordens magneter och himlens mirakel. Båda är verktyg i deras kamp för att kontrollera varandra och naturen omkring dem. Alla sådana försök har dock sitt pris, för varken människa eller natur låter sig betvingas utan att de förr eller senare slår tillbaka.

Magneter och mirakel är ett komplett rollspel med smidiga regler som låter er skapa huvudroller på bara några minuter. För att det ska vara lätt att komma igång finns också fyra äventyr i flera genrer för olika spelgrupper.

User translation:

Title: Magnets and Miracles

The world is changing. The goblins under the mountains provide the humans with technology that they're getting more and more dependent of, but the humans also find their own ways of using the earth's magnets and the sky's miracles. Both are tools in the struggle to control each other and the nature around them. However, all attempts like that have its price, because neither man or nature will be subdued before striking back.

Magneter och mirakel is a complete role-playing game with flexible rules that let you create player characters in just a few minutes. For a smooth start, four adventures in several genres for different player groups are included.

132926.name: Muhammad Ali: Heavyweight Boxing
132926.description:
User Summary

A boxing game featuring Heavyweight Boxing legend Muhammad Ali. Face off against over 30 other rivals in a single match or go for the world title.

132927.name: Mr. Chin's Gourmet Paradise
132927.description:
Mr. Chin's Gourmet Paradise is a platformer video game for the Nintendo Game Boy.

The point of the game is to feed Mr. Chin some momos, which are turned into peaches via the Demoe beam. Bricks can be broken inside the games levels to obtain power-ups. Points in the game are actually "calories;" which determine how well-fed Mr. Chin is. There are a pre-determined number of enemies that must be defeated before Mr. Chin can move on to the next level. Being invincible automatically turns all opponents into edible peaches.

When Mr. Chin loses all lives, the Game Over screen shows him in prison, suggesting that his deeds throughout the game are not actually appreciated.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mr. Chin's Gourmet Paradise", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132928.name: Mouse Trap Hotel
132928.description:
Mouse Trap Hotel is an action video game for the Nintendo Game Boy.

The object of this game is to take Maxie the Mouse as he tries to visit his girlfriend. Unfortunately, she is located in a penthouse while Maxie dwells in the basement. By finding the exit in each level, he draws closer to being with his girlfriend. Side-scrolling segments with some vertical elements are an expected part of the game. Getting hit by mousetraps and enemies causes Maxie to lose his energy. As expected with most platform games, getting hit too frequently causes the player to lose a life. Maxie's tail comes in handy when it comes to destroying enemies.

Each floor has its own obstacles; which range from mattress springs in the bedroom to dancing legs at the ballroom. Players must ride an elevator to each new floor where dangers constantly lurk about in places like the kitchen and the gymnasium.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mouse Trap Hotel", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132929.name: Mortal Kombat & Mortal Kombat II
132929.description:
User Summary

A compilation cartridge for the Game Boy containing Mortal Kombat and Mortal Kombat II.

132930.name: Monster Truck Wars
132930.description:
User Summary

An above-view racing game featuring monster trucks. Run over cars for power-ups and avoid obstacles as you try to beat your competitors around the track.

132931.name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (Game Boy)
132931.description:
The Game Boy version is a side-scrolling action game with five levels, each consisting of two segments. In the first segment, the player will control one of the five original Power Rangers as they fight the Putty Patrollers throughout the stage in order to reach their goal. The player can switch between a standard punch attack or a Power Weapon attack that will gradually consume their life gauge when used. When the player reaches the end of the level, they will control Megazord and fight a giant monster. Like the rangers, the Megazord can switch a regular sword attack and a lightning bolt sword attack that will consume a great portion of the life gauge.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132932.name: Metal Masters
132932.description:
The player controls a robot, the starting robot is a very basic model, to which the player can add "improvements" with credits earned during gameplay. There are four areas that each robot is graded on, body, left arm, right arm, and legs. There are several different combinations of various parts that can be added to the player's robot for optimum fighting status. During a fight, each area mentioned above is represented by its own health meter. The objective of the player is to deplete the health meters of each area.

Source: Wikipedia, "Metal Masters", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132933.name: Megalit
132933.description:
User Summary

In this puzzle game, boxes of different sizes are stacked up, and it is your job to get them to the ground. Remove boxes carefully, because if boxes fall from more than a height of 1 space, it will break and you will have to attempt the level again.

132934.name: Malibu Beach Volleyball
132934.description:
User Summary

2-on-2 beach volleyball on the Game Boy. Play a single match or best of three.

132935.name: Angry Birds Trilogy
132935.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three Angry Birds titles, reworked and brought to the console market for the first time.

132936.name: Over the Wall
132936.description:
Designer Summary

You want to make it Over the Wall and into Paradise. The problem is that the Bot city of Vaturdu is in the way and the only viable currency is your very skin. How much is Paradise worth to you?

You play cloned human youth raised to be the hope and future of the denizens of a dystopian robot city in which flesh is currency and everyone wants some, because you have to be part human to make it over the wall to the paradise beyond.

132937.name: Disney Epic Mickey: Power of Illusion
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
132937.description:
Power of Illusion takes place some time after the events of Epic Mickey. The evil witch, Mizrabel, and her Castle of Illusion, have been accidentally transported to the Wasteland by the wizard Yen Sid. Oswald the Lucky Rabbit contacts Mickey Mouse to tell him the castle has mysteriously arrived in Wasteland and that Minnie Mouse has been spotted inside of it. Mickey then sets off to save Minnie and the "Illusions" of other Disney characters trapped in the castle. Characters confirmed to appear in the game are Scrooge McDuck from the DuckTales franchise, Ariel, Ursula and Sebastian from The Little Mermaid, Peter Pan, Rapunzel from 2010's Tangled, Jafar from Aladdin, the Queen of Hearts from Alice in Wonderland and Gopher from the Winnie the Pooh franchise. Several in-game locations have also been revealed: Agrabah, an Aladdin themed area, King Triton's undersea kingdom, and Rapunzel's tower from Tangled.

With players taking control of Mickey Mouse, the game mixes side-scrolling gameplay from games such as Castle of Illusion with the paint and thinner mechanics from Epic Mickey. Using the 3DS touch-screen, the player will be able to bring items scattered throughout each stage into existence. How well the player traces these items will affect their performance. For example, tracing a cannon perfectly will ensure that it only harms enemies, but an imperfect cannon could be a danger to everyone in the area, including Mickey himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Epic Mickey: Power of Illusion", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132938.name: Football Manager 2013
videogamehonor: 2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
132938.description:
Football Manager is the best-selling, most realistic football management series ever made. Football Manager 2013 celebrates 20 years of games from the people at Sports Interactive by introducing an array of new features.

This year's version allows you to take control of any club in more than 50 nations across the world and includes all of Europe's biggest leagues as well as database of over 500,000 real-world players and staff.

You're in the hot-seat, which means you decide on who plays and who sits on the bench, you're in total control of tactics, team-talks, substitutions and pitch-side instructions as you follow the match live with the acclaimed 3D match engine allowing YOU to make the difference!

As well as some landmark new features in the Career Mode, there are now new ways to enjoy your Football Manager experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

132939.name: Forza Horizon
videogameversion: North American Xbox 360 Limited Collector's edition
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Driving Game of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best British Game of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Debut Game of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
132939.description:
Forza Horizon is an open-world game based around a fictitious festival called the Horizon Festival, set in Colorado, USA. The game incorporates many different gameplay aspects from previous Forza Motorsport titles, like the large variety of cars, realistic physics and high definition graphics. The aim is to progress through the game by means of obtaining "Wristbands" by driving fast, destroying property, winning races and other driving antics. Horizon is set to feature the physics of Forza Motorsport 4, which have been optimised to work on the 65 variants of terrain said to be present in the game. Players will be able to drive anywhere their cars can reach, such as fields and plains.

Multiple race types are included, from drift to rally and point-to-point races. AI traffic will be present on the roads, which provides a new dynamic to the Forza racing system. Players may also challenge other Horizon festival drivers they encounter in a one-on-one race to a given location. The location is random each time, and the AI have the ability to use shortcuts to their advantage. Races will take place at different times throughout the day/night cycle included in the game, including night races. A skill system is implemented in the game; players earn street cred during races by driving aggressively. Acts such as as drifting, jumping over obstacles and getting a car on two wheels all contribute to the cred. These can be chained together in a combo, which in turn affects the money players are paid at the end of a given race. Cred also affects a player's popularity level in the game. As a player's popularity increases new special events are unlocked, such as races against helicopters and planes.

Speed traps are present in the game, and players can challenge each other for the top speed in a given area. Cameras record player times, which can then be shared among rivals. Those rivals can then attempt to beat the shared time. A photography mode is also included. In addition to races, players can search for barn find cars—cars that have been stored away for long periods of time—have them restored, and add them to their car collection.

Source: Wikipedia, "Forza Horizon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132940.name: Just Dance: Disney Party
132940.description:
The game is similar to Just Dance Kids 2 with the live action dancers, the game modes (Team High Scores, Freeze & Shake, Balloon Pop), and the animated score icons, except it includes a duet mode, where in the first two Just Dance Kids games; all the songs had three dancers. In addition, all the songs are the original versions, not covers.

The gameplay is identical to the other games in Ubisoft's franchise, Just Dance. Players are required to perform specific dance moves in time with the music, following a routine indicated on-screen and performed by live dancers. If the player performs well, by dancing accurately and in-time, their score will build and a rating out of 5 stars is obtained upon completion of the track.

Source: Wikipedia, "Just Dance: Disney Party", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132941.name: NBA 2K13
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2013 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
132941.description:
With more than 5 million copies sold worldwide and more than 25 Sports Game of the Year awards won, NBA 2K12 was another monster release for the biggest NBA video game simulation franchise in the world. This year, 2K Sports has joined forces with the legendary JAY Z as Executive Producer to transcend sports video games and take virtual hardwood to the next level. Featuring an enhanced MyCAREER mode and all-new gameplay features, NBA 2K13 will let gamers pit the best players in NBA history against the new dynasty of talent, including the much-debated matchup between the 2012 U.S. Men’s National Team and the 1992 “Dream Team.”

Source: The Developer Website.

132942.name: Zero Escape: Virtue's Last Reward
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Multiplatform Game of the Year Winner
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Story of the Year Winner
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Villain of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
132942.description:
Sigma, the main character, is kidnapped and awakens in an elevator with a girl named Phi, who seems to know him. Zero III, a talking rabbit, appears on a computer monitor in front of them and tells them they must escape the elevator; the pair find themselves in an abandoned warehouse alongside seven other people. Their goal is to escape the building. However, they find themselves enrolled in a game known as the Nonary Game: Ambidex Edition, which relies on a system called "Bracelet Points" ("BP"), which are won by cooperating with or betraying other players. A player is allowed to leave the warehouse if only they possess nine or more BP; however, if a player's BP reach zero, they are killed by a lethal injection.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zero Escape: Virtue's Last Reward", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132943.name: World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
videogamehonor: 2013 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
132943.description:
Unleash the Secrets of a Lost Continent

Shrouded in fog since the world was sundered more than ten thousand years ago, the ancient realm of Pandaria has remained unspoiled by war. Its lush forests and cloud-ringed mountains are home to a complex ecosystem of indigenous races and exotic creatures. It is the homeland of the enigmatic Pandaren, a race that celebrates life to the fullest even while under siege by an ancient menace.

The new continent reveals itself to a broken world just as the Alliance and Horde are spiraling ever closer to a war that will consume all of Azeroth. Will the mists of Pandaria part to reveal the world's salvation? Or will the battle to control this rich and breathtaking new land push the two mighty factions over the brink of war and into total annihilation? The answers await within Pandaria's mysterious shores!

Source: The Game Website.

132944.name: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 13
videogamehonor: 2012 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
132944.description:
Tiger Woods PGA Tour 13 is a golfing simulation video game in the Tiger Woods PGA Tour series published by Electronic Arts. This is the first version of the game since 2006 not to be released on the Wii.

Tiger Woods PGA Tour 13 features a game mode called "Legacy Challenge," where players control Tiger Woods through various points of his life.

Tiger Woods PGA Tour 13 will allow players to team up with friends in an Online Country Club or to create their own. The Country Club will allow members to earn Status Points and Coins that can be used to play rounds on a downloadable course or to unlock Boost Pin packs for their golfer.

The Online Country Club will feature stat breakdowns to allow members to compare themselves to other members. The Country Club also offers a tournament creation feature for members to compete for the title of Club Champion.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tiger Woods PGA Tour 13", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132945.name: PlayStation All-Stars Battle Royale
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Winner
132945.description:
The gameplay is conceptually similar to the Super Smash Bros. series, in which up to four players can battle each other using characters from various Sony franchises such as God of War, PaRappa the Rapper and Sly Cooper, as well as third-party franchises like BioShock. There are, however, differences in how opponents are defeated. During the game, players damage other players to receive orbs that build up a power meter at the bottom of the screen (These orbs can also be found on the stage over the course of the match). Earning enough power allows players to use one of three levels of super moves which can be used to defeat opponents and earn points. Arenas are also inspired by various PlayStation titles, with some areas mashing up two titles into one (for example, a LittleBigPlanet-themed stage which is mixed with Buzz!). The game will feature cross-platform play between the PlayStation 3 and PlayStation Vita versions.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation All-Stars Battle Royale", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132946.description:
In Plenty of Fish in the Sea? players take on the role of a shoal of fish trying to survive on a Coral Reef.

With a limited amount of fish and actions to perform, they must try to shoal their fish to avoid starvation, predators and also remember to spawn and thus increase the gene pool. Players may place tiles, rotate them or move fish to attempt to maximize their final score at the game end.

In Plenty of Fish in the Sea? you're not paranoid, everyone is out to get you!
132946.name: Plenty of Fish in the Sea?

132947.description:
Whether any animal on our beautiful planet has a future is determined by how it can respond to the environmental cards dealt out by the cold & sweeping hand of fate.

For thousands of years in isolated New Zealand / Aotearoa our largest browsers and predators were birds. The around 1280AD, everything changed. New predators arrived, and they swept the birds before them..

To save birds of New Zealand / Aoteaora, you need to create a feather cloak in one bird realm: forest, settlement, sea, or extinct. Trade, draw, & play, to build a 15-card triangle-shape cloak.

But whenever you pick up a predator card, your birds are in danger! If both bird & predator card have matching (same illus, same position) icons on the grid down the RHS - then that bird gets eaten (discarded). There are cards you can play that keep the predators at bay (god-cards, wild-card Pandora), and ways to draw more cards (music-note on card = pick-up). They are powerful, but occur in limited numbers. You cannot save everything - so can you still make a feather cloak?
132947.name: Cloak of Protection

132948.name: Ice Breaker
132948.description:
User Summary
A bunch of your viking buddies have gone and gotten themselves in a host of predicaments. Now you must rescue them; gather your friends into the longboat by slicing through sections of ice, rope, and other 'cuttables,' leading your friends back to the beloved longboat.

132949.name: The Star Game
132949.description:
The Star Game is a 3-dimensional occult board game for two players. In addition to being a game, it is also used as occult sorcery with each occult initiate expected to make their own boards and pieces.

There are two versions of the game, the simple and the advanced. The simple game has seven boards placed one above the other in a spiral, with the boards named after particular stars. Each board has nine black and nine white squares, making 126 squares in total over the seven boards. Each player (white and black) starts the game with three sets of nine pieces (27 pieces per player) with each piece allowed to move across a board, and up or down from board to board, in a different way. Only some types of pieces can capture other opposing pieces, and a captured piece is removed from the boards and plays no further part in the game.

The seven boards are named Naos, Deneb, Rigel, Mira, Antares, Arcturus, and Sirius. At the start of the game, each player has six particular pieces on Sirius, three pieces on Arcturus, six pieces on Antares, three on Rigel, six on Deneb, three on Naos, and none on Mira. As in other board games, the players take turns to make their moves.

The basic rule of play is that after a piece has been moved - whether across a board or from one board to a higher or lower board - it is transformed into another piece according to a set sequence and then can be moved according to its new designation. Another rule is that pieces can only stay on the Mira board for three moves.

The basic aim of the simple form of the game is for one player to place three of their pieces on certain squares on Mira, with the type of these pieces and their placing on that board decided by both players beforehand. The first player to do this wins the game. This takes some skill and some time since not only can an opposing player capture pieces on Mira but also pieces are only allowed to stay on Mira for three moves, after which the player must move the piece. Depending on the skill of the player, to win a simple game takes from a few hours to a day or more.

In the advanced Game, each board has six (minor) boards (three at each end), with there being additional pieces (more sets of nine for each player making 81 pieces per player). There are also additional rules regarding movement. In this version of The Star Game, each board is divided into three other levels so that there are four levels to each board, making a total of 308 squares over the seven main boards. Depending on the skill of the player, to win an advanced game can take several days.

In both the simple and the advanced games, the pieces are usually small tetrahedrons (or small squares) marked with the particular abstract symbol (or the particular occult symbol) which is used to designate that type of piece.

Complete game rules are outlined in "NAOS: A Practical Guide to Modern Magick". A free software version is also available.

132950.name: RuneQuest Games Master's Pack
132950.description:
from the front page

This pack contains two scenarios for RuneQuest: Meeros Falling - an introductory scenario that follows-on from the events described in Anathaym's Saga in the RuneQuest rules; and The Exodus Matrix, a Sword and Sorcery adventure that formed part of the playtest for the sixth edition rules.

The remainder of the pack is a compilation of the major charts and tables used in the rules. Also included are a set of Combat Condition markers, a summary of Combat Special Effects for use by players, the RuneQuest Character Sheet and Combat Tracker sheet.

The Design Mechanism wishes to thank Shawn Tomkin for his work on the Condition Markers and Special Effects summaries.

132951.name: Public Playtest Package (2012-10-29)
rpg: Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition, Playtest & Promotional Docs)
132951.description:
User summary:

The October 29th playtest package updated the classes, supporting levels up to 10. It also includes a new adventure, and many new monsters were added to the Bestiary.

This playtest packet included:


A Read First document (2 pages)
A How To Play guide (24 pages)
A Creating a Character guide (5 pages)
A Classes guide (14 pages)
A Races guide (8 pages)
A Backgrounds and Skills guide (10 pages)
A Specialties and Feats guide (7 pages)
A Spells guide (20 pages)
An Equipment guide (11 pages)
A DM Guidelines guide (15 pages)
A Bestiary (54 pages)
A Magic Items guide (31 pages)
A Maneuvers guide (4 pages)
Five pre-generated character sheets (12 pages)
A blank character sheet (2 pages)
An adventure, Caves of Chaos (23 pages)
An adventure, Reclaiming Blingdenstone (40 pages)
An adventure, Isle of Dread (44 pages)

132952.name: Wild Cards: Backyard Birds
132952.description:
This card game + book set features songbirds, woodpeckers, hummingbirds, birds that are tricksters, little chirpers and more. Learn about each bird’s personality and how to identify them.
Learn about birds as you play three favorite card games: Memory, Old Maid, and Go Fish. Created in association with the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, and filled with wonderful images from leading wildlife photographers.

132953.name: Helter-Skelter
boardgameversion: Universal Publications Children's Party Game Edition
132953.description:
A party game intended for children.

The host 'hides' each Key Card in different locations around the area where the party is being held. The house or/and the garden would be most likely.

Each player is given a noun and must find that noun, written on the top left of one of the Key Cards. When found, it will say which noun to find next, and so on, until one player has found all 12 nouns in the correct order and written on their score-pad. That player is the winner.

The game is intended for up to 12 players but the publisher is rather optimistic in suggesting that if you buy extra cards (which he says are available at '12 for sixpence) then there is no reason why 500 people can't play. The publisher also suggests that you could play on a much wider area, with cards hidden so far apart, the players would need bicycles to get from one card to another.

132954.name: Z-Corps - Edition Deluxe
132954.description:
French (fom publisher's website) :

Z-Corps est un jeu de rôles qui vous propose de découvrir un monde ravagé progressivement par une apocalypse zombie. D’abord limitée à certains territoires, cette épidémie va s’étendre au fil des parties, renforçant le sentiment d’urgence et d’insécurité. Plus les scénarios avanceront et plus les personnages devront agir vite, afin d’enrayer la progression de la contagion et en comprendre l’origine.

Vous pourrez, au choix, jouer un simple Survivant, fuyant les hordes de zombies affamés ou un membre des unités Z-Corps, milice privée et indépendante de la société OneWorld chargée de combler les déficiences de l’armée et d’enquêter sur le terrain.

Ce livre présente en détail l’univers de Z-Corps, ainsi que l’intégralité des règles du jeu, utilisant l’Open D6.

Il est divisé en 3 parties distinctes, qui sont réservées aux joueurs ou au Meneur de Jeu, selon le type de jeu souhaité. Vous trouverez également à la fin de cet ouvrage deux scénarios :

• Open all night (scénario “Survivants”)
• Sunday Night Fever (scénario Z-Corps)

English :

Z-Corps is a role-playing game that invites you to discover a world ravaged gradually by a Zombie Apocalypse. Initially limited to certain areas, the epidemic will spread over the game sessions, strengthening the sense of urgency and insecurity. The more the scenarios and characters advance the more they must act quickly to stop the spread of contagion and understand the origin of the disease.

You can, optionally, simply play a Survivor, fleeing hordes of hungry zombies or a member of the Z-Corps units, private militia of the independent company OneWorld responsible for filling the deficiencies of the army and to investigate in the field .

This book presents in detail the universe of Z-Corps, as well as all the rules of the game, using the Open D6.

It is divided into three distinct parts, which are reserved for players or Game Master, depending on the type of game you want. You will also find at the end of this book two scenarios:

• Open all night (scenario "Survivors")
• Sunday Night Fever (scenario "Z-Corps")

132955.name: Tatus Monstruosos
132955.description:
A book about giant armadillos!

Publisher blurb:
Uma das coisas que mais evoca o fantástico nos cenários de RPG são as criaturas fabulosas que povoam esses mundos imaginários. E dentre todas elas, algumas das mais icônicas são aquelas que possuem inúmeras variações: dragões, gigantes, elfos, etc.
A idéia para esse livro veio de um mal entendido no fórum Dragonsfoot, quando ao ler o release de O Forte das Terras Marginais, os gringos imaginaram que “armadilhas” pudesse ter alguma relação com “armadillo” (“tatu” em inglês). O que se iniciou como uma piada interna sobre uma aventura com tatus gigantes acabou por se tornar inspiração para um tipo de monstro novo e completamente único ao Old Dragon.

Mas como tornar os singelos e inofensivos tatus em algo realmente digno de ser enfrentado? Simples: com descrições interessantes e ilustrações inspiradas! Foi divertido fazer esse suplemento, espero que lê-lo e usá-lo seja tão divertido quanto para vocês.

Google translation
A book about giant armadillos!

Publisher blurb:
One of the things that evokes the fantastic RPG in scenarios are fabulous creatures that populate these imaginary worlds. And among all of them, some of the most iconic are those that have many variations: dragons, giants, elves, etc..
The idea for this book came from a misunderstanding forum Dragonsfoot when reading the release of The Fortress of Marginal Lands, gringos imagined that "traps" might have something to do with "armadillo" ("armadillo" in English). What began as an inside joke on an adventure with giant armadillos eventually became inspiration for a new kind of monster and completely unique to Old Dragon.

But how to make simple and harmless armadillos into something truly worthy to be faced? Simple: with interesting descriptions and illustrations inspired! It was fun making this supplement, I hope you read it and use it as fun as it is to you.

132956.name: Caçada ao Robô Assassino
132956.description:
From publisher blurb:

Com medo? Eu? Imagina! Minha família nunca se sentiu ameaçada pelo nosso robô. Ele lava, passa, cozinha e até brinca com as crianças! O Júnior adora quando o nosso novo RAM-06 da Sarego Corp. o ajuda com o dever de casa! - Janet Moohr, 32, Saturno
A vida seria muito boa se tudo fosse como um comercial de máquina de lavar roupas. Mas não é bem assim. O que acontece quando o cérebro positrônico defeituoso de um robô passa por uma tempestade eletroradioativa e ele se torna um voraz assassino? Quem será corajoso o suficiente para descobrir o que aconteceu na espaçonave Lagosta V? E o que são aquelas massas gosmentas no teto?
Embarque na nave do capitão Fox Branches rumo ao espaço infindável e traga o cérebro do robô assasino de volta! Trezentos mil créditos aguardam por sua tripulação. Mas cuidado: os agentes da concorrência não vão poupar esforços para se apoderar dos segredos industriais contidos no cérebro!
"Caçada ao Robô Assassino" é uma aventura de Space Dragon para personagens de 1º nível escrita por Rafael Beltrame e ilustrada por Dan Ramos e Rafael Ramos.
Peguem aquele cérebro!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Afraid? I? Imagine! My family has never felt threatened by our robot. He washes passes, kitchen and even play with the kids! The Junior loves it when our new RAM-06 Sarego Corp. helps with homework! - Janet Moohr, 32, Saturn
Life would be very good if everything were as a commercial washing machine. But not quite. What happens when the positronic brain of a defective robot passes through a storm eletroradioativa and it becomes a voracious killer? Who will be brave enough to find out what happened at the Lobster V spacecraft? And what are those slimy masses on the ceiling?
Boarding the ship's captain Fox Branches into the endless space and bring the killer robot brain back! Three hundred thousand credits await his crew. But beware: the agents of the competition will not spare efforts to seize their trade secrets contained in the brain!
"Hunt for Robot Killer" is an adventure Space Dragon for characters of level 1 written by Rafael Beltrame and illustrated by Dan Ramos and Rafael Ramos .
Catch that brain!

132957.name: Minchiate
132957.description:
Minchiate is a card game from Italy with 97 cards, most likely invented in the 15th century in Florence, though its exact date is unknown. The earliest mention known dates from 1466. The cards were largely based on Tarot, at the time known as Tarocchi in Italy, by expanding the trump suit to 40 trumps. It was also known as Germini and Gallerini in other parts of Italy. It was played up until the 1930s.

Over time, numerous of games played with the very same deck were known as Minchiate, some including partnership and some not, and also differing in numbers of players.
Minchiate games are all trick taking games of the Tarot family, although they introduce a few features that are unique and exclusive to Minchiate. Among these are scoring points for certain combinations of cards won in tricks, named 'versicole', and a different distribution of point values for the cards.

There were also a few gambling games played with the Minchiate deck not from the tarot family of card games, among them 'Al Palio' and 'A sei tocchi'.

132958.name: Barrowmaze II
132958.description:
From the front cover:

Hidden in Barrowmaze for centuries, the dark power of The Tablet of Chaos has called the dead to rise from their graves. Nergal's unholy relic must be destroyed but few have explored deep enough (or lived long enough) to reach it. Can you survive the long dark Barrowmaze and destroy The Tablet of Chaos?

boardgamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines & Wrath of the Cosmos
132959.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines features two new time-traveling heroes, four villains (some of which may be familiar to Sentinels fans), and two time-displaced environments! Besides just expanding the number of characters and environments available to players, Shattered Timelines introduces new mechanisms and exciting new challenges. Can you repair time before it runs out?!
132959.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines
boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards
boardgamepodcastepisode: House Rules 46: Shattered Timelines Announcements
OBG 114: I'll Place My Worker Here

132960.name: Lazlos' Leap
132960.description:
User Summary

A portable version of the abstract game, peg solitaire.

132961.name: Knight Quest
132961.description:
User Summary

An early, simplistic RPG where you take control of a 14 year old boy named Will that has dreams of becoming a knight.

132962.name: Livret et Ecran
132962.description:
French (from publisher's website) :

"Sur une durée suffisamment longue, l’espérance de vie tombe, pour tout le monde, à zéro."
-- Fight Club

Pour accompagner l'écran quatre volets de Z-Corps, vous trouverez dans ce livret un scénario inédit "survivant" faisant suite à Open All Night, pouvant être joué en one-shot ou dans la storyline Z-Corps, Clinique Apocalypse.

English :

"On a long enough period, life expectancy falls to zero for everyone."
- Fight Club

To accompany the four components screen of Z-Corps, you will find in this book a new storyline "Survivor" scenario following Open All Night. Named "Clinique Apocalypse" It can be played as a one-shot or in the Z-Corps storyline.

132963.name: King James Bible
132963.description:
The full King James version of the Bible is on this cartridge. Also contains two word games (based on memory and hangman) as well as an action game called Joshua: The Lost Levels based off of previous release Joshua & the Battle of Jericho.

- User Summary

132964.name: Ōkami Kakushi
132964.description:
A 15 year old boy named Hiroshi Kuzumi recently moved into a new town in the mountains. The town is separated into new and old streets by a river and many mysterious local cultures still remain. The towns people are unusually friendly to him but one person kept her distance from him: class committee member Kushinada Nemuru. In their few encounters she gave him a word of advice: "Stay away from the old streets."

Hiroshi learns about the town's local traditions and legends, most prominently the ones about the local Wolf Spirits. However, something mysterious goes on in the background; people mysteriously "move away" and students suddenly "transfer schools" while none of the locals pay any attention. Hiroshi initially tries to ignore it, but he soon sees a girl with an enormous scythe along with people in strange masks kill someone that was written off to have "moved away" the next day. Hiroshi is soon drawn into the dark secrets long hidden by the townsfolk and uncovers a plot to destroy the town.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C5%8Ckami_Kakushi,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132965.name: The Jetsons: Robot Panic
132965.description:
Robots have gone berserk, and it is up to the Jetson family to save the day. Play as Judy, Elroy, Jane, and George, each in their own level with their own special tool.

- User Summary

132966.name: Jeopardy! Teen Tournament
132966.description:
It's the Teen Tournament version of classic game show, Jeopardy! The difficulty level of questions have been toned down and are more appropriate for the teenage age group.

- User Summary

132967.name: Jeopardy! Platinum Edition
132967.description:
An updated set of questions for the Game Boy version of the classic game show, Jeopardy!

- User Summary

132968.name: The Braunstein Game
132968.description:
In 1967* Wesely served as referee for a Napoleonic wargame set in the fictional German town of Braunstein. As usual, two players acted as commanders of the opposing armies, but because he was interested in multi-player games, Wesely assigned additional, non-military roles. For example, he had players acting as town mayor, banker, and university chancellor. When two players challenged each other to a duel, Wesely found it necessary to improvise rules for the encounter on the spot. Though Wesely thought the results were chaotic and the experiment a failure, the other players enjoyed the role playing aspect and asked him to run another game.

Wesely thus contributed to the development of RPGs by introducing: (1) a one-to-one identification of player and character, and (2) open-ended rules allowing the players to perform any action, with the result of the action determined by the referee.

[*] 1969: Tresca, Michael J. The Evolution of Fantasy Role-Playing Games. McFarland & Company, 2001. p60.

From Wikipedia, David Wesely, The Braunstein Game. Available under the CC-BY-SA license:

132969.name: Jack Nicklaus Golf
132969.description:
Golf simulation game featuring pro golfer Jack Nicklaus.

- User Summary

132970.name: Itchy & Scratchy in Miniature Golf Madness
132970.description:
Itchy & Scratchy in Miniature Golf Madness is a side-scrolling action game. The player takes control of Scratchy as he plays through various mini golf courses, trying to achieve a good score, while at the same time avoiding Itchy's attacks. Itchy uses weapons such as grenades, bazookas, chainsaws, meat cleavers, and dynamite. Scratchy can acquire items, such as a baseball bat or throwing knives, and power-ups to defend himself against Itchy. He can also use his putter as a weapon. There are a total of nine levels, or holes, in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Simpsons: Itchy & Scratchy in Miniature Golf Madness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132972.name: Jedi: Duellspelet
132972.description:
Translated from the back:

In this game the good fights the evil during the clone wars. Every time the good and the evil meet on the board they have a duel. The player who first get past the evil warriors, and reach the goal, wins the game.

In this game the player move along a 18 spaced track by rolling a die numbered 0-3. They also roll a fighting die that allows an evil warrior to enter the track. If you enter a space with an evil warrior, you have to fight it by rolling the fighting die.

132973.name: Iron Man / X-O Manowar in Heavy Metal
132973.description:
The storyline is revealed through onscreen text, instead of animated sequences. Iron Man and X-O Manowar must team up in order to stop a team of supervillains from grabbing the lost fragments of the Cosmic Cube.

Both Iron Man and X-O Manowar can jump, punch, shoot an unlimited supply of laser beams (that can be upgraded through icons) and use a limited supply of fuel to fly. At the start of each mission, a computer screen informs you of your objectives.

During the game the player can collect medical icons to restore their health, and other icons to give more fuel, stronger laser blasts and a special icon that allows one mega blast from a character's armor chestplate. The game also allows one to destroy various gas canisters, metal wiring and control panels to locate more icons, deactivate certain weapons, or advance in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Iron Man / X-O Manowar in Heavy Metal", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

132974.name: In Your Face (1990)
132974.description:
A simple basketball game with four characters to choose from for 1-on-1 or 2-on-2 matches. You can choose to play for a set amount of time or first to reach a set amount of points.

- User Summary

132975.description:
Listen close: an eerie sort of tune can be heard, softly emanating from a mysterious source somewhere in the castle. Join our mouse heroes as they investigate the spooky music while keeping Crumbles out of trouble.

Cat's Cradle is the first downloadable chapter for Mice and Mystics. You get a brand new chapter — a lost chapter — in the tale of Collin and his friends. This scenario uses four mice of your choice.
132975.name: Mice and Mystics: Lost Chapter – Cat's Cradle

132976.name: Mork from Ork Name Game
132976.description:
Game published in the UK Issue 34 of Cracked Magazine.

The board is a deceasing circle track ultimately leading to the middle of the board. Movement is by the roll of one die. The object is to collect letter cards that spell out MORK FROM ORK. The first one to do so, wins. If you get to the centre without a complete sewt, you must discard two letters and go back to the start to try again.

In the grand tradition of magazine games, all the cards have to be cut out before play can begin.

132978.name: The Worth of a Slave
132978.description:
From Introduction:

In the first chapter of the Ashes of Athas campaign, the PCs are all members or affiliates of the Veiled Alliance (VA) in Tyr. A group known as The True has been working in secret against the Tyrian Veiled Alliance, and has finally secured the edge that they need – inside information about the members, hideouts, and meeting places of the Alliance. A member of The True named Obadias is leading a brutal attack on the Veiled Alliance, attempting to eradicate their presence in Tyr.

In the opening encounter, the adventurers are waiting for a meeting with two high-ranking leaders of the Veiled Alliance, Sartaj and Marama. The safe house where they are to meet is invaded by True soldiers. After dealing with the initial incursion and escaping the safe house, the adventurers learn that Sartaj, Marama, and many other Alliance members have been captured. At this point, they can either join in the fight against the numerous agents of The True, or avoid the devastation and flee.

Any adventurers that manage to escape can learn that at least of the captured Alliance members, including Sartaj, were sold to a slave caravan due to leave soon. The adventurers will need to find some way to get themselves into Avram’s slave caravan. This might include being captured, sneaking in, or even selling themselves into slavery.

While they travel with Avram’s caravan, they have some opportunities to help their injured leader, and potentially make enemies and allies while planning their escape. Once Sartaj recovers, she offers to arrange a diversion, but she needs the assistance of the adventurers.

Eventually, the diversion arrives, in the form of an attack on the caravan by a group of giantkin. The adventurers who survive the initial onslaught gather up whatever materials and allies they can manage, and head across the unfriendly desert for sanctuary in the town of Altaruk.

132979.name: The False and the True
132979.description:
From Introduction:

This is the second of three adventures set within the Ashes of Athas Dark Sun campaign.

In AOA1-1: The Worth of a Slave a secret society known as the True annihilated the Veiled Alliance organization in Tyr. The PCs fled Tyr by infiltrating a slave caravan. There they helped their cell leader, Sartaj, escape to Altaruk. The PCs likely expect Altaruk to be a safe haven. Nothing could be further from the truth.

132980.description:
The Leadslinger Dogs of War Troop for Tooth & Nail: Factions is an additional Troop for the special Dogs of War faction. If playing Tooth & Nail: Factions with the Dogs of War faction, just add the stack of 5 Leadslinger cards during the setup per the regular Dogs of War rules. Just like the original four Troops in the mini-faction, this additional Troop acts as a soldier for hire within the game.

LEADSLINGER

Strength: 1
Action: Reaction: If an action would affect a single Troop, you choose what Troop it affects. Counts as any Tech Troop.
Troop Type: Tech
132980.name: Tooth & Nail: Factions – Leadslinger Dogs of War Troop

boardgamecompilation: Omen: A Reign of War – Omega Edition extras
132981.description:
Relics of Olympus is mini expansion for the Omen: A Reign of War game.

There are 6 different Relics:

FORGE OF HEPHAESTUS - When a Soldier enter this city on your side, it gains 1 additional strength until the end of your turn.
HELM OF HERMES - When you play a Soldier into this city from your hand, you may draw 1 card. If you do, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
APHRODITE'S ROSE - During your Portent step, when you reveal the top card of the deck for an Oracle's ability in this city, if an Oracle is not revealed, you may reveal 1 additional card.
DEMETER'S SCYTHE - When you play a Unit into this city from your hand, you may discard 1 card from you hand. If you do, reduce that Unit's cost by 1.
APOLLO'S CREED - If an ability of an opposing player's Unit would cause a Soldier in this city to be discarded, you may instead discard a Soldier from your hand of the same name.
DIONYSUS' FLASK - When a Soldier enters this city, of either side, ignore its ability. During either player's Portent step, Oracle abilities in this city are not used.




Relics begin play to the side of the play area. Once per Feat Step, if the player would achieve a Feat, instead of flipping that Feat face down, he may instead gain a Relic. He selects a Relic from the side of the play area and places it face up on his side of any City.

There may only be 1 Relic per City. If a player chooses to place a Relic he has just gained in a City that already has a Relic in it, the original Relic is moved to the side of the play area, even if the Relic was on the opposing player's side of the City.

Each Relic is worth 1 point to the player at the end of the game.
132981.name: Omen: A Reign of War – Relics of Olympus

132982.name: The True Lesson Learned
132982.description:
From Introduction:

This is the third adventure in the Ashes of Athas campaign. In AOA1-1: The Worth of a Slave, an organization known as the True attack and destroy the Veiled Alliance in Tyr. The PCs barely escape with their lives, then learn that Sartaj, a Veiled Alliance cell leader, has been captured and is on board a slave
caravan headed for Altaruk. The PCs free the cell leader and reach Altaruk.

In AOA1-2: The False and the True, the True continue their attacks, this time in Altaruk. The PCs are implicated in the assassination of Ariphistaneles, the village’s leader. The PCs race to find clues and beat back the true, while helping chose alliances that will strengthen the village. At the conclusion the elven assassin, Deevo, is uncovered, and the PCs prepare to confront him. He escapes on a chariot, fleeing to the True’s base.

132983.description:
The Long Shadow promo expansion for Hemloch includes:

4 alternate ability Location cards - These 4 location cards will also include the original Location cards on the back side, making it easy for you to mix and match which version of the Locations you want to use for your Hemloch games.
5 Scepter cards - The Scepters are a new item that can be acquired by players, similar to Trinkets and Potions. If the players wish to play with the Scepters, at the beginning of the game, 4 Potion and 4 Trinket cards are placed back in the box, and players will have access to 5 Trinkets, 5 Potions, and 5 Scepters during the game. When two of these piles are depleted, the game ends. If a player would gain a Trinket or Potion, he may instead gain a Scepter.
132983.name: Hemloch: The Long Shadow

132984.name: Plotting the Course
132984.description:
From Introduction:

In the Chapter 1 of Ashes of Athas, the PCs arrived in the town of Altaruk after escaping a purge of Veiled Alliance members and affiliates in Tyr by a group calling themselves “the True.” In Altaruk, the governor of the town, Lord Arisphistaneles (hereafter called Lord Aris), showed himself to be a Veiled Alliance sympathizer. Unfortunately, Lord Aris was assassinated and the PCs framed for the murder. The PCs were able to clear their names and catch the real assassin. The PCs also foiled a plot of the True to turn an ancient elemental temple into a place that would serve the True’s evil plans.

Three weeks have passed since the assassination, and Lord Aris’ daughter Sartaj has claimed the governorship of Altaruk. While some have happily accepted her leadership, the town of Altaruk exists for the betterment of the merchant houses there, particularly House Wavir, House Tomblador, and House Rees. Without the backing of these houses, no one can hold power in Altaruk for long.

Since the town of Altaruk’s reason for existence is to serve the needs of the merchant houses, anyone hoping to hold the leadership of the town must gain and maintain at least some support from each of the houses; however, each of the houses also has its own agenda and intrigues. Each house wants favor shown to their interests, and the houses are not above bribery, extortion, blackmail, sabotage, and even murder to further their goals.

In fact, as Sartaj takes the reins of the town, each of the houses is using unscrupulous means to position itself to affect the political climate in Altaruk.

House Wavir wants to see Sartaj remain the leader of the town, but one of their members fears a Balican templar is going to be installed as leader. This Wavir agent takes it upon herself to hire a group to assassinate the templar before he arrives in Altaruk.

House Rees is unsure of who might make the best leader for their interests, but they know that Sartaj needs their support. Therefore, they seek to gain as many concessions from her as they can in return for their support. Unfortunately for them, the House Wavir member hired Rees mercenaries to assassinate the
templar, leaving Rees in an awkward position. They are implicated in the assassination attempt, but they also know that a House Wavir member is ultimately behind the plot.

House Tomblador has done the most to undermine Sartaj, but they are clever enough to cover their tracks well. They hope to make Sartaj look incompetent, forcing Balic to seize tighter control of the town. Tomblador feels Balican leadership best serves the house’s interests and hurts the other houses.

132985.name: Allies Kept Closer
132985.description:
From Introduction:

In the Chapter 1 of Ashes of Athas, the PCs arrived in the town of Altaruk after escaping a purge of Veiled Alliance members and affiliates in Tyr by a group calling themselves “the True.” In Altaruk, the governor of the town, Lord Arisphistaneles (hereafter called Lord Aris), showed himself to be a Veiled Alliance sympathizer. Unfortunately, Lord Aris was assassinated and the PCs framed for the murder. The PCs were able to clear their names and catch the real assassin. The PCs also foiled a plot of the True to turn an ancient elemental temple into a place that would serve the True’s evil plans.

Approximately four weeks have passed since the assassination, and Lord Aris’ daughter Sartaj has claimed leadership of Altaruk. While some have happily accepted her leadership, the town of Altaruk exists for the betterment of the merchant houses there, particularly House Wavir, House Tomblador, and House Rees. Without the backing of these houses, no one can hold power in Altaruk for long.

Each house maintains a contingent of guards that helps the Watch maintain peace. Since Sartaj’s ascension, each of the houses has drawn back its guards, keeping a closer eye on house investments. Indeed, each of the merchant houses is somehow complicit — knowingly or unknowingly — in the troubles currently threatening Altaruk and Sartaj’s rule.

Andropinis, at the request of Tomblador, has sent a templar to investigate the situation in Altaruk and make recommendations on who should govern it. Praetor Verzonious has a useful psionic wild talent. He can change his features, something he uses to look just like his scribe. This allows his scribe to pose as the templar, which they do when traveling.

In AOA2-1, while en-route to Alataruk, the templar’s caravan was attacked and saved at the last minute by the PCs. The PCs have escorted the templar to Alataruk.

Meanwhile, they discovered unknown enemies poisoning the water supply of Altaruk, and thwarted it. Crime is on the rise in the village and things are not looking good for Sartaj.

132986.name: A Time to Stand
132986.description:
From Introduction:

In the Chapter 1 of Ashes of Athas, the adventurers escaped a purge of the Veiled Alliance in Tyr by a group calling themselves “the True”, rescuing their cell leader, a human woman named Sartaj, in the process. Having escaped slavery, the remnants of the Veiled Alliance made for the trade-town of Altaruk. In Altaruk, the governor of the town, Lord Arisphistaneles (hereafter called Lord Aris), showed himself to be a Veiled Alliance sympathizer. Before the adventurers could
establish themselves in Altaruk, Lord Aris was assassinated, and the adventurers were framed for the murder. They were eventually
able to clear their names, and chased down the true assassin, who was heading to an ancient elemental temple in the badlands
near Altaruk. Inside the temple, the adventurers discovered and foiled a True plot to pervert the temple and elementally empower members of the True, perhaps rescuing an influential resident of Altaruk in the process.

Sartaj, the daughter of Lord Aris, has claimed leadership of Altaruk amid the turmoil of a troubled succession. In Chapter 2, the adventurers worked to stabilize Altaruk, attempting to gain the backing of the merchant houses Wavir, Tomblador, and Rees. Depending on the outcome, they may now have ties to one or more of these Balikite trade houses.

Trouble has not left Altarkuk, and the adventurers raced to stem the rising tide of attacks on caravans coming into and out of
Altaruk, as well as an increase in crime within the town. In AOA2-2, the adventurers discover that someone is organizing slave tribe attacks, probably agents of the True. Depending on their actions they may have won the support of one of these tribes.

The True have been a constant threat, and the adventurers may be eager for a direct confrontation with their nemeses. That wish will soon be granted, as the adventurers prepare for a massed attack on Altaruk.

132987.description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

From the card:
"Game End: Ignore your final score; you finish in 2nd place."
132987.name: Paperclip Railways: Stupid City

132988.name: Wooden Railway Bridge
132988.description:
From the Introduction:

Although the surrounding lands sure are quite dry and arid a small river has dug has dug a small canyon into the landscape here. To allow trains to cross it enterprising engineers built a wooden bridge across the gorge. Only a layer of thin boards hides the fact that the bridge is nothing but a framework of wooden beams, moving and squeaking whenever it has to bear a heavy load. Still, the construction is sturdy enough and has stood for quite a few years and it will probably last for at least a few decades more.

132989.name: Little Wheel
132989.description:
User Summary

Once there was a world full of living robots. Everything was great until one day there was an accident at the power generator. On that day everything shut down. 10000 years later lightning struck one intrepid robot and it was enough to bring it back. Take control of this robot and bring power back to all the robots in this point and click adventure game.

132990.name: Transylvania
132990.description:
User Summary

Sometimes when potatoes sleep, they drive off into dangerous places and then must figure out how to get out of a bad situation. Take control of just such a potato in this point and click adventure game. There are many spooky dangers and other troubles the potato must navigate. Solve the puzzles and then move to the next room.

132991.name: SushiGoRound!
132991.description:
Sushi Go Round puts you in charge of a Sushi Restaurant. It’s your job to turn it into a successful enterprise and keep your customers happy. Recipes will need to be memorized, meals will need to be prepared, ingredients will need to be orderd and the business will need to be expanded.

-User Summary

132992.name: Play with the Teletubbies
132992.description:
User Summary

Play With The Teletubbies was designed for 2-to-4-year-olds. Children can freely explore Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po. They can join the Teletubbies for a day of play and song, as well as discovery.

132993.name: Time Killer
132993.description:
User Summary

A very angry and stressed out man has decided to destroy all the clocks in a town so that he will be able to relax. Guide him on his path in this point and click adventure game.

132994.name: Pearl Harbor: The Day of Infamy
132994.description:
The player takes control as Command Leader of a squadron aboard a U.S. Navy Gunship. The game features shiptoair and sea defensive battle stations, more than 100 progressive missions, and sophisticated enemy AI.

-User Summary

132995.name: Neil the Nail
132995.description:
User Summary

The nails are at war with the hammers, and only Neil the Nail has a chance to combine forces with Mr. Magnet to defeat them. Solve each puzzle to move on to the next in this point and click adventure.

132996.description:
Spook is a 2 or 4 player game where you take turns adding or subtracting from residents by playing cards trying to hit the exact number on the residents on your side to successfully scare them off. Have your team scare off the most points worth of residents to be the winner.

You are ghosts haunting the furniture trying to scare out all the residents.
132996.name: Nathan Bryan's Spook

132997.name: Galidor: Defenders of the Outer Dimension
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
132997.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




User Summary

Taking on the role of the hero Nick Bluetooth players find themselves in an Outer Dimension to free friends who have fallen into the clutches of the evil tyrant Gorm.

132998.name: Horrid Henry: Missions of Mischief
132998.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Players take on the role of Horrid Henry as they run and jump through a series of levels.

132999.name: The Living Dead
132999.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Based on Romero's zombie movies he wrote the script and story direction himself. Survive in a city overrun by the living dead in a carnage-filled gaming nightmare.

133000.name: Rebirth of Honor
133000.description:
User Summary

Rebirth of Honor is an expansion for IL-2 Sturmovik "Forgotten Battles". It allows players to battle for supremacy in the years of 1941 and early 1942 and an alternate-reality 1942 and beyond. The missions that take place prior to the middle of 1942 are created around real world events, locations and weather conditions. The missions flown in late 1942, after Hitler's death, take place where the future of Germany, its strategy for fighting the war and its economic situation are all in flux.
